title.$t: Issues - chromium
The updater fails from 195.1 to 195.3

content.$t:
This is happening only on XP ! Works fine on Vista.

-Install 3.0.195.1 Chrome version
-Run the updater (195.3_from_195.1_chrome_updater)

The updater fails with registry key ap is set to 'full'

Expected:
Should update to 195.3 !

title.$t: 1366x768 mp4 video crash

content.$t:
this video crashes chrome 3 and 4 (aww snap)
http://fbarchard-kir.ad.corp.google.com/mediatests/runthrough.mp4 file.
it works okay in safari and mplayer.
it decodes okay in media_bench as well.

the video is 1366 wide which is not a multiple of 16.
a 1280x720 version of the same video is okay.
it was encoded with adobe media encoder

the problem is likely a memory overflow.

title.$t: Security: net::HttpStreamParser::DoReadBodyComplete OOM browser crash using Content-Length

content.$t:
The following HTTP reply will crash the browser (not just the renderer) because of OOM. It is marked as a low severity security bug because this is a DoS.

"HTTP\r\nContent-Length:6719476739\r\n\r\n"

It seems obvious that the problem is that there are no checks on the supplied "Content-length" value and Chromium attempts to allocate enough memory to be able to read that many bytes, which fails.

Here's the relevant part of the stack:
`anonymous namespace'::OnNoMemory(void)+0x3 [c:\b\slave\chromium-rel-xp\build\src\chrome\app\chrome_dll_main.cc @ 128]
realloc(void * ptr = 0x026209e8, unsigned int size = 0x6f7cebfd)+0xcb [c:\b\slave\chromium-rel-xp\build\src\third_party\tcmalloc\allocator_shim.cc @ 178]
net::GrowableIOBuffer::SetCapacity(int capacity = 1870457853)+0x68 [c:\b\slave\chromium-rel-xp\build\src\net\base\io_buffer.cc @ 25]
net::HttpStreamParser::DoReadBodyComplete(int result = -100)+0x143 [c:\b\slave\chromium-rel-xp\build\src\net\http\http_stream_parser.cc @ 386]
net::HttpStreamParser::DoLoop(int result = 0)+0x136 [c:\b\slave\chromium-rel-xp\build\src\net\http\http_stream_parser.cc @ 156]
net::HttpStreamParser::ReadResponseBody(class net::IOBuffer * buf = 0x03a59230, int buf_len = 32768, class CallbackRunner<Tuple1<int> > * callback = 0x03b2d690)+0x12d [c:\b\slave\chromium-rel-xp\build\src\net\http\http_stream_parser.cc @ 96]
net::HttpNetworkTransaction::DoReadBody(void)+0x143 [c:\b\slave\chromium-rel-xp\build\src\net\http\http_network_transaction.cc @ 911]
net::HttpNetworkTransaction::DoLoop(int result = 0)+0x422 [c:\b\slave\chromium-rel-xp\build\src\net\http\http_network_transaction.cc @ 468]
net::HttpNetworkTransaction::Read(class net::IOBuffer * buf = 0x03a59230, int buf_len = 32768, class CallbackRunner<Tuple1<int> > * callback = 0x03b0befc)+0x29b [c:\b\slave\chromium-rel-xp\build\src\net\http\http_network_transaction.cc @ 328]
net::HttpCache::Transaction::ReadFromNetwork(class net::IOBuffer * data = 0x03a59230, int data_len = 32768)+0x21 [c:\b\slave\chromium-rel-xp\build\src\net\http\http_cache_transaction.cc @ 1025]

Question: I recall seeing a bug for this exact same issue before - do we not have a test to check against regressing? Can we have one please?

title.$t: Sometimes window dragging mode gets enabled without the possibility to anchor the window back

content.$t:
Chromium	4.0.208.0 (Developer Build 25971)
WebKit	532.0
V8	1.3.10
User Agent	Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux x86_64; en-US) AppleWebKit/532.0 
(KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/4.0.208.0 Safari/532.0

I usually close a tab with two buttons click emulating a middle click, 
sometimes it happens that tab dragging is activated instead and it can't be 
anchored (clicking Esc doesn't help either), the only solution is to kill 
Chromium as the minimised window keeps following the mouse.

title.$t: Twitter.com Crashes Chrome

content.$t: Chrome Version (from the about:version page): 6.0.437.3 (Official Build 50164) dev Is this the most recent version: yes OS + version: Ubuntu Lynx CPU architecture (32-bit / 64-bit): 32-bit Window manager: Gnome URLs (if relevant): http://twitter.com/ What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Browse to twitter.com and log in 2. After page loads, chrome crashes (including all tabs and other windows opened). Other info: - Seems to work fine after I cleaned my cache, but Chrome started crashing again after a few visits - I have geolocation enabled for twitter.com - Chrome does not crash when I visit twitter.com in a Private Browsing window I will post more info as I notice anything, but I wanted to get this down before it crashed again.

title.$t: OSX Omnibox context menu differs from Windows.

content.$t:
The Windows context menu has:
 Undo
 ----
 Cut
 Copy
 Paste
 Paste and search (or Paste and go)
 ----
 Select all
 ----
 Edit search engines...

Mac has Cut, Copy, Paste, Font>, Spelling and Grammar>, Substitutions>, Speech>, Writing 
Direction>, and a variety of context-sensitive options "Open URL", "Make Link", "Search in 
Spotlight", "Search in Google", and "Look up in Dictionary".  All of the context-sensitive items 
appear at the top, so even if they do belong here on some level, on another level they probably 
shouldn't interfere with important items like the editing commands.

title.$t: All webpages are painted white

content.$t: Chrome Version : 4.0.207.0 OS: 10.6.0 URLs (if applicable) : .* What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Go to any web site. What is the expected result? Web page shows up. What happens instead? Web page loads, and the mouse cursor updates as if the web page was there (status bubble and when you hover over links), but the tab remains white. I've seen this only on my gf's computer, not on mine (perhaps because she has SL and I have Leopard), it started happening after the update to 207. Running with a different user data dir didn't help. Restarting chrome multiple times didn't help either. One of the two will be used. title.$t: Dropdown menu: item can not be selected

content.$t: Platform: Hostname: RohMac-2.local Mac OS X Version 10.5.8 (Build 9L30) Processor: 2 Intel 2.40 GHz RAM: 2048 MB Chrome: Chrome version: 4.0.213.1 <<<Release>>> QuickTime Player: 7.6.2 QuickTime PlayerX: <unknown> Flash Player: 10.0.32 What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Open any page which has dropdown menu. (ie. http://www.travelocity.com/) 2. Select any item from dropdown menu. Expected result: 2.1 Item is selected. Actual result: 2.2 Item is not selected. Next time dropdown menu won't open. Note: We could narrow down the problem with CL in between 26851:26860, http://build.chromium.org/buildbot/perf/dashboard/ui/changelog.html?url=/trunk/src&range=26851:26860

title.$t: URL text cut off

content.$t: Chrome Version : 219.3 (Developer Build 27222) URLs (if applicable) :any with letters that have tails Other browsers tested: Add OK or FAIL after other browsers where you have tested this issue: Safari 4: Firefox 3.x: IE 7: IE 8: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1.type in bugzilla.liveops.com into url bar What is the expected result? bugzilla.liveops.com shows up What happens instead? buozilla.liveoos.com shows up, bottom of text is cut off when not selected. Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible. selecting url moves it up a couple of pixels so it looks correct

snej: Assigning this to you since I seem to remember you did some work on the tooltip code, do you have any idea what might be happening here?

title.$t: Nested message loops don't seem to work on Mac

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. sign into gmail 2. start a new email message in a new window (Shift-C) 3. address it to yourself 4. move the focus to the subject field 5. click discard button 6. say "ok" to the alert What is the expected output? What do you see instead? The window should go away but it doesn't. If you try to send an email with an empty body, the alert from that also doesn't seem to let the message go. 221.8 acts as listed, my current trunk debug build almost does the same ting, except a second click on the discard results in sadtab for both the popup compose and main browser.

title.$t: Crash on quit

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Start up Chrome Mac (r 28825 ) with just a themed empty window with a single bookmark in the bookmark bar. 2. Quit What is the expected output? What do you see instead? No crash Instead I'm getting a crash because the view is attempting to determine whether or not it is opaque, and it's controller (that it references) is already gone. Note that I appear to be the only one seeing it, but it definitely is a bug. This was with a clean build at the top of tree.

title.$t: Chrome crash: dragging an image on the browser

content.$t: Platform: Hostname: RohMac-2.local Mac OS X Version 10.5.8 (Build 9L30) Processor: 2 Intel 2.40 GHz RAM: 2048 MB Chrome: Chrome version: 4.0.237.0 r31086 <<<Release>>> QuickTime Player: 7.6.4 QuickTime PlayerX: <unknown> Flash Player: 10.0.32 What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Have any image in TextEdit.app 2. Login to Gmail and click on 'Compose Mail'. 3. Try to drag image from TextEdit to Gmail compose text box. Expected result: 3.1 Image can be dragged to Gmail compose text box. Actual result: 3.2 Chrome crashes. Note: - Breakpad doesn't generate crash report for this crash. - Chrome also crashes if dragging an image just on the browser. GMail is an example where dragging an image is useful to compose an email.

title.$t: Crash - objc_msgSend in -[ChromeEventProcessingWindow sendEvent:]

content.$t:
We've been seeing some crashes like:
   http://crash/reportdetail?reportid=863a1bb50832215a
I believe that this is likely to be similar to Issue 24987, where some of our objects are being released out from under us in an event loop.  This bug is to act as 
an attractor for these crashes.

title.$t: Chrome has zombie helpers running

content.$t: Platform: Mac OS X Version 10.5.8 (Build 9L31a) Processor: 2 Intel 2.33 GHz RAM: 2048 MB Chrome: Chrome version: 4.0.295.0 r35884 QuickTime Player: 7.6.4 Flash Player: 10.0.42.34 What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Expected: We only get Chrome Helper processes for the renders, plugins, extensions currently in use. Actual: We see multiple zombie Chrome Helpers.

title.$t: Renderer crash on http://acid3.acidtests.org/

content.$t:
With 5.0.307.7, there seem to be lots of crashes for renderer 
http://acid3.acidtests.org/.

Most of the reports have no stack trace, i.e. http://crash/reportdetail?
reportid=6aebb840783251c9.

I suspect maybe it's OOM, like the case on Windows, i.e. 
http://crash/reportdetail?reportid=f4c26528ede7cdff

0x68863565 	[chrome.dll 	- v8proxy.cpp:226] 	
WebCore::reportFatalErrorInV8
0x68d4d6bf 	[chrome.dll 	- api.cc:174] 	
v8::internal::V8::FatalProcessOutOfMemory(char const *)

but someone on IRC reported this is a segfault, which may be 
http://crash/reportdetail?reportid=eca599866ec3dc2c

Thread 0 *CRASHED* ( SIGSEGV @ 0x00000004 )
0x087cebc1 	[chrome 	- global-handles.cc:105] 	
v8::internal::GlobalHandles::MakeWeak(v8::internal::Object**, void*, void 
(*)(v8::Persistent<v8::Value>, void*))
0x08e9086d 	[chrome 	- ScriptState.cpp:95] 	
WebCore::ScriptState::empty()
0x0935bd9d 	[chrome 	- V8NodeIteratorCustom.cpp:66] 	
WebCore::V8NodeIterator::nextNodeCallback(v8::Arguments const&)
0x087b4e13 	[chrome 	- builtins.cc:386] 	
v8::internal::Builtin_HandleApiCall(v8::internal::Arguments)
0x0935bd6f 	[chrome 	- V8NodeFilterCustom.cpp:47] 	
WebCore::V8NodeFilter::acceptNodeCallback(v8::Arguments const&)
0x0935bd6f 	[chrome 	- V8NodeFilterCustom.cpp:47] 	
WebCore::V8NodeFilter::acceptNodeCallback(v8::Arguments const&)
0x087b4b6f 	[chrome 	- builtins.cc:472] 	
v8::internal::Builtin_HandleApiCallAsFunction(v8::internal::Arguments)
0x09093b0f 	[chrome 	- RefCounted.h:109] 	
WebCore::DocumentInternal::createTreeWalkerCallback(v8::Arguments const&)

It works fine here with 307.5. Did something regress?

title.$t: If Firefox is default and running, Chrome can't be launched after install

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Make Firefox as default browser and have it running 2. Install Chrome 6.0.472.0(Dev channel build) What is the expected output? Search ballot should be seen What do you see instead? Search ballot is not seen. Even trying to launch Chrome manually doesn't work and creates zombies.

title.$t: [Content Settings] Chrome built-in features should not be affected by the options in Content Settings

content.$t:
Currently the options in Content Settings also affect many chrome built-in
features like Extensions, Inspector(Developer Tools), about pages with
prefix "about:"(e.g. about:version), built-in pages with prefix
"chrome://"(chrome://history), this causes many issues like, those pages
could not be displayed, crashes, etc.

Content Settings feature should not have conflict with those existing
features, in other words those existing chrome built-in features should not
be affected by the options in Content Settings, otherwise many problems
would happen.

content.$t:
The attached files demonstrate the error. I have a suggested patch, to 
follow.

title.$t: Regenerate the test server certificate net/data/ssl/certificates/ok_cert.pem in year 2013.

content.$t:
The test server certificate net/data/ssl/certificates/ok_cert.pem
will expire on July 27, 2013.  We will need to regenerate it in
year 2013.

It may be a good idea to generate a new certificate that essentially
doesn't expire (has an expiration data very far in the future).

The Test CA also expires on July 27, 2013, so this bug appies to
the Test CA, too.

title.$t: Dragging files to desktop will get a wrong file name

content.$t: Chrome Version : 2.0.164.0 (9941) URLs (if applicable) : Other browsers tested: Add OK or FAIL after other browsers where you have tested this issue: Safari 3: Firefox 3: OK IE 7: OK What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. dragging a file, usually a image with a hyperlink that link to another page/file, to your desktop. For example, try to drag the logo of Google code at the left-top corner. The image name is "code_sm.png" and has a link to "http://code.google.com/" 2. The file you dragged will get a wrong name based on its hyperlink, instead of its own name. The name of logo you dragged is "google.png" 3. What is the expected result? file should get its original name What happens instead? wrong name Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible.

title.$t: Extension manifest parsing is not sandboxed

content.$t:
(Tracking bug).

The extension manifests and resources are loaded in the unsandboxed browser 
process, which is bad.

title.$t: Implement final management UI

content.$t:
The management UI should replace the current chrome://extensions UI. I think 
that we don't need both a user-oriented management UI *and* an 
about:extensions style UI.

The management UI should include:

- name, icon for each installed extension
- ability to disable/re-enable or uninstall each extension
- (in some kind of right-click or similar menu): if there is a background 
page running, ability to inspect that

title.$t: Lower the max size for media cache.

content.$t:
The current max size for the media cache (audio/video) is set to 1.8GB at the 
browser level. The browser should just pass 0 and let the network code decide 
what the max size should be.

On a related note, I don't think the cache for media files should be bigger 
than the regular cache, which grows with the available disk space, currently  
up to 320 MB.

title.$t: google calendar bug - event details not showing

content.$t: Chrome Version : 3.0.182.2 URLs (if applicable) : http://www.google.com/calendar/render Other browsers tested: Safari 4: Firefox 3.x: OK IE 7: OK IE 8: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Log into Google calendar 2. Click an event and choose "Edit event details" What is the expected result? Event details showing and editable What happens instead? "Loading" appears at the top-right corner And the main screen is blank.

title.$t: REGRESSION: Back navigation broken

content.$t:
Apologies for the internal URL, but this is where I'm noticing it. Others 
might see this on public web sites.

1. Start at any page.
2. Navigate to who/mal
3. Click on an entry under mal.
4. Click the back button or press Alt+LeftArrow

Expected:
Go back to the page you went to in step 2.

Actual:
Goes back to the page in step 1.

(Version information at the bottom)

When starting up Chromium, it always appears very far off to the right of 
the screen. Very much off screen. I have to set the window to "Move" and

Position does not seem to be remembered for windows. When I close the only

It just downloads and sits there Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible. It used to work until the latest update, I think

title.$t: Background tabs opened from Google Reader auto-close

content.$t:
Visit Google Reader and middle click the gray, circular "chevron" image to 
the right of a post's title.  For me, a background tab opens and then quickly 
closes again (!).  Dragging from the chevron to the tab strip (which opens as 
a foreground tab) works fine.

Not sure what other places this can affect.

title.$t: string constants use "Google Chrome" instead of product id

content.$t:
A few strings use "Google Chrome" directly instead of using 
IDS_PRODUCT_NAME with the sprintf fetchers, so the Chromium versions of 
the app say Google Chrome.

IDS_SINGLE_DOWNLOAD_REMOVE_CONFIRM_TITLE,
IDS_MULTIPLE_DOWNLOADS_REMOVE_CONFIRM_TITLE,
IDS_IMPORT_PROGRESS_EXPLANATORY_TEXT_MAC,
IDS_NEW_TAB_CHROME_WELCOME_PAGE_TITLE,
IDS_NEW_TAB_THEMES_GALLERY_PAGE_TITLE

title.$t: Images on Flickr not clickable

content.$t: Chrome Version : 4.0.206.0 URLs (if applicable) : OS version : 10.5.8, 10.6.0 Behavior in Safari 3.x/4.x (if applicable): Works fine What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Go to http://www.flickr.com/search/?q=kittens&z=t What is the expected result? The small thumbnails should be clickable. What happens instead? They are not. Works fine in Safari. Switching to "medium" thumbnails makes it work in chrome too. Oh, looks like it's broken on linux and windows too. Probably a webkit regression. I'll file anyway, so that it doesn't get lost. (#webkit says it's broken in a recent webkit build too. They point out that clicking in the lowest 20% of the image works).

title.$t: Do something on successful installation

content.$t:
We should do something simple to indicate successful installation. It is 
disconcerting when you install something like an extension that uses page 
actions and it does nothing at all.

Some options:

a) Show some kind of "hooray!" bubble
b) Open a tab with information provided by the extension developer (and 
default it if not supplied)
c) Go to chrome://extensions/ and use a yellow fade effect to show the new 
extension

I like b) because it gives extension developers a place to explain how to 
use their extension. I like c) because it is more consistent, particularly 
in the case where an extension developer doesn't need to show anything at 
this point. I don't like a) at all, but present it because we talked about 
it before.

title.$t: All content scripts for a given extension should execute in the same isolated world
Data race on reference counter from LoadLog

content.$t:
This data race was detected by ThreadSanitizer.

Related to http://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=18488

(the following is copied from the discussion here 
http://codereview.chromium.org/215011)
============
timurrrr wrote
I've reproduced the report on LoadLog
http://build.chromium.org/buildbot/waterfall.fyi/builders/Modules%20Linux%2
0(...
It's a bit damaged due to inlining.
However, you may notice net/base/host_resolver_impl.cc:152 out there.
On that line there is a few Request objects deleted and it contains 
LoadLog.
ThreadSanitizer saw acceses to this reference counter from at least two 
threads.

I'll re-run the test locally and will have complete (not-inlined) 
stacktraces of
both accesses soon.

============
eroman wrote
5 minutes ago
Ah okay. I think I understand the problem now, thanks!

(If a request is cancelled, the HostResolverImpl::Job will be freed on the
worker thread, so in turn the HostResolverImpl::Request gets freed on the 
worker
thread, and calls LoadLog::Release()).

I would like to solve this by clearing the LoadLog within
HostResolverImpl::CancelRequest(), rather than making it 
RefCountedThreadSafe.
Can file this bug against me?

title.$t: Browser actions (and page actions): Need to be able to decode images on the fly

content.$t:
I thought there was a bug on this already, but couldn't find it.

During the implementation of PageActions we discussed being able to change 
the icon to something that was not necessarily declared in the manifest. This 
would require changes to how we unpack the images in the renderer.

Now, with the concept of a BrowserAction (bug 22099), this looks to me like 
it is becoming a requirement.

title.$t: download item menus and download mgr share strings

content.$t:
The menu items off a download item and the links in the download manager 
html should be different string ids since the different contexts could need 
different phrasing.

title.$t: browser actions: popups should have a nice border

content.$t:
See the mocks in issue 23596 for an example.

For now, we'll make the border fixed.  In the future, we may want to support 
a 9-grid API to allow authors to do something custom.

title.$t: browser actions: popup actions shouldn't show up in the wrench menu

content.$t:
It probably doesn't make sense for browser actions that have associated 
popups to show up in the wrench menu since there probably isn't a good 
logical expected behavior.

title.$t: browser actions: popup position is a little too low

content.$t:
It used to be up against the bottom of the button highlight.  It appears to 
have shifted down a bit, probably due to the recent badge changes that 
expanded the size of the toolbar area.

title.$t: Finalize browser actions API

content.$t:
They should both have the API documented at 
http://code.google.com/p/chromium/wiki/BrowserActions, except the page 
actions API should have an additional show(int tabID) method, and should 
not have the badge related methods.

We need to keep the current page action API for compat. This should be easy 
to do in extension_process_bindings.js.

I'm currently thinking that we should allow multiple browser actions and 
page actions per extension.

My reasoning is that although it would be neat to have one-extension one-
feature, we cannot come up with any way to do this and allow extensions to 
communicate easily. Also, it would increase memory bloat (more processes).

title.$t: Convert the Gmail checker extension to use browser actions

content.$t: We should do this as a proof of concept of the idea

title.$t: browser actions: popups are a little slow

content.$t:
Click on a browser action with a popup (try set_page_color), and there's 
sometimes a slight lag before the popup appears.

In this case, there are three interesting pieces:
- spinning up the extension process (set_page_color has no other views)
- creating a render view
- waiting for layout to finish (so we know the width)

The other possibility is that this is a Debug vs. Release perf issue.

title.$t: Find-in bar should give keyboard access to chat input box on a IFrame.

content.$t:
Build:4.0.221.6

-Login to Google corporate/Internet email a/c.
-Start chatting with one of your buddy.
-Ctrl+F to find-in bar and type foo
-[Hit esc to dismiss find-in bar - but really not required]
-Try to set keyboard focus on Chat input box.

You can't. Caret blinks in the input box but never stays. To get ride of
this, you need to close and restart the chat box.

Marking this as DEV blocker.

title.$t: Canceling "bookmark all tabs" still creates the folder

content.$t:
"Bookmark all tabs" and then hit Cancel in the resulting dialog.  It creates 
your folder anyway :(

title.$t: Remove menu integration from browser actions

content.$t:
a) Incompatibility with dynamic images. We currently assume that if there is 
not at least one icon in the icons list in the manifest, that it should not 
have space in the toolbar. However, with dynamic images, we would like users 
to not have to put anything in the manifest. The workaround is to put a 
transparent gif as your single icon in the manifest, which is ghetto.

b) Weird UI. After building and using a gmail checker browser action, I 
conclude it is weird to put every browser action in the wrench menu 
automatically. In this case, having something happen when you click the icon 
is not really the main feature. It certainly doesn't warrant an appearance in 
any menus.

I think that we should split menu items out into a separate explicit API.

title.$t: REGRESSION: Selecting "Copy email address" in MAILTO: links includes the mailto:

content.$t: Chrome Version: 4.0.221.6, Windows What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Right click a link with an email address (mailto: link) 2. Select "Copy email address" 3. Paste the email address somewhere What is the expected result? Only the email address is pasted (no mailto:) What happens instead? The entire HREF is pasted (including mailto:) NOTE: This INCLUDES mailto links with GET variables (ex: mailto:bl@a.h? subject=your%20mom)

title.$t: Implement per-window browser action details

content.$t:
This probably relates to bug 23879 (rationalize browser and page action 
apis).

There have been requests to be able to set the icon/badge/whatever 
differently per-window for browser actions.

Before working on this, we need an API proposal.

title.$t: max 1 UI surface per-extension

content.$t:
For extensions beta, we want to start out limiting extensions to a maximum of 
1 UI "surface". By "surface", we mean toolstrip, browser action, or page 
action.

UI management gets much simpler if there is a concrete relationship between 
user-visible features and extensions. And since we now have the bubble, and 
will eventually have the options UI, we think that there should be enough 
real-estate for people to do interesting things within this limitation.

At the very least, it easier to add than take away, so we would prefer to 
start with 1 and relax over time.

title.$t: Make page actions API more like browser actions API

content.$t:
See bug 23879 and design doc: 
http://code.google.com/p/chromium/w/edit/PageActionAPIv2

title.$t: Implement badges for page actions

content.$t: Page actions should have badges, just like browser actions.

title.$t: It should be legal to include zero icons in a browser action

content.$t:
Right now we require at least one icon be registered, as we use this to 
determine whether to show the browser action at all. This makes using canvas-
backed browser actions a little more painful because you have to provide a 
starting icon.

However, once bug 24379 is fixed, we should be able to remove this.

title.$t: You should be able to use (slightly) bigger icons in browser actions (and maybe page actions)

content.$t:
Glen and Cole claim the max size is 19, and that page and browser actions are 
the same. When I measured it on the mocks, it looked more like 21 and that 
page actions were smaller.

title.$t: Acrobat Reader 9.2 plugin does not paint until window is resized

content.$t: Chrome Version : 4.0.221.6 URLs (if applicable) : http://www.karlin.mff.cuni.cz/~motl/entan- interpret.pdf Other browsers tested: Add OK or FAIL after other browsers where you have tested this issue: Safari 4: OK Firefox 3.x: OK IE 7: ? IE 8: OK What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Run Adobe Acrobat Reader and in Help / Check for updates, update to newest 9.2 2. Click any PDF link to open PDF within a Chrome window. 3. See that it shows nothing. 4. Try to repeat (1) but shift/click for a new window: it will show up. What is the expected result? The PDF files should be opened within the Chrome window. What happens instead? The PDF files are not opened in the Chrome window. Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible. This bug only seems to arise when the newest Adobe Acrobat Reader 9.2 is installed. The problem doesn't occur with Firefox 3.5.3 or Internet Explorer 8 or Safari 4. If you experience the problem, I recommend you to either: 1. Use shift/click instead of click to open PDF links in Chrome 2. Run Acrobat Reader, go to Edit / Preferences / Internet, and uncheck "Display PDF in browser" 3. Regulate your anger, limit your usage of PDF (or temporarily switch to another browser), and wait until the Chromium team fixes this bug.

title.$t: enforce min/max size for extension popups

content.$t:
Right now, they have no enforcement, so overly small and super large popups 
are possible.

title.$t: Certain WebKit features need to be properly hidden before we ship a beta

content.$t:
This bug is for tracking when all of our disabled by default features that 
are exposed to JavaScript are properly hidden.

Ones that are already done:
Audio/Video
Shared workers
WebSocket

Ones that still need to be done (that I know about):
DOMStorage
AppCache
Notifications
WebDatabase

The owners of these are cc'ed on this bug.  Please take care of your own 
features.

title.$t: REGRESSION: Focus ring for hyperlinks appears and stays after click.

content.$t: Chrome Version : 4.0.223.9 URLs (if applicable) : http://msgplus.net/download/ for example Other browsers tested: n/a What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Go to http://msgplus.net/download/ 2. Press the download image 3. Notice that the green or orange (I am colorblind, can't tell you the color) rectangle isn't the same size as the image. What is the expected result? Not to show the green/orange rectangle around links, and absolutely not around image links What happens instead? See reproduction steps Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible. Might also be the wrong size for (text) links with the css 'margin' or 'padding' set.

title.$t: Remove badges from page action API

content.$t:
Badges don't look good on page actions because there isn't enough room to 
position them outside the button border like we do with browser actions.

Sorry mpcomplete :(

title.$t: Extensions: Utility process crashed while trying to install

content.$t: Chrome Version : 4.0.223.9 URLs (if applicable) : Any extension (e.g. off http://www.chromeextensions.org/) Other browsers tested: N/A Add OK or FAIL after other browsers where you have tested this issue: Safari 4: Firefox 3.x: IE 7: IE 8: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Download a crx file 2. Run it 3. What is the expected result? Extension installs. What happens instead? One of two things: 1) Loading box freezes on screen. No install. 2) Get an error box with the following message: --------------------------- Extension Install Error --------------------------- Utility process crashed while trying to install. --------------------------- OK --------------------------- Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible.

title.$t: doc for pageAction onClicked event handlers doesn't match reality

content.$t:
The doc at:

http://src.chromium.org/viewvc/chrome/trunk/src/chrome/common/extensions/docs/pageAction.html

makes it look like the pageAction onClicked handers get called with a tab object. In reality, they 
get called with (pageactionid, details) where pageactionid is a string, and details is an object 
with "button", "tabId", and "tabUrl" properties. 

I think we changed the doc (and extension_api.json) to reflect how we *want* the API to work, but 
not the actual implementation.

title.$t: html5 audio/video content doesn't load in Chrome

content.$t: Chrome Version : 4.0.223.11 URLs (if applicable) : tinyvid.tv Other browsers tested: firefox =>3.5 Add OK or FAIL after other browsers where you have tested this issue: Safari 4: N/A Firefox 3.x: OK IE 7: N/A IE 8: N/A What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. open any html5 video site 2. try to play the video 3. no way to reproduce them What is the expected result? play a simple online video What happens instead? no video is whown Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible. N/A just a grey box appear with controls and deactivated play button

title.$t: Standardize on the puzzle piece icon throughout the extensions system

content.$t:
Places we need to change:

* The header icon on chrome://extensions/
* The default icon in the install dialog

title.$t: Extension doc diagrams need to be updated

content.$t:
These diagrams:
http://code.google.com/chrome/extensions/overview.html#arch

Need to be updated to reflect the new world order post-browser-actions.

title.$t: We should not dispatch extension events unless somebody is listening

content.$t:
The extension system currently listens to all tab and window events and 
builds up JSON details to send to extensions, even if no extensions are 
listening or even installed.

This is pretty wasteful and we shouldn't do it.

As a side-effect, this will probably reduce the frequency of bug 25558.

title.$t: REGRESSION: Right click on folder in Bookmarks Bar context broken; causes crash

content.$t: Chrome Version : 40229.0 (30454) URLs (if applicable) : Other browsers tested: Add OK or FAIL after other browsers where you have tested this issue: Safari 4: Firefox 3.x: IE 7: IE 8: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1.Right-click on folder in Bookmarks Bar 2.Left-click context menu appears instead of right-click menu where previously you could select "open all tabs". 3. Expected as above What happens instead? Eventually Chromium crashes Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible.

about:plugins shows Java SE 6 U10 installed, but if I visit a page that uses 
it, e.g. http://weegames.com/clues.php?PAGE=3 , the plugin never starts.

content.$t:
Some people have reported it being confused with the normal web inspector (eg 
ctrl+shift+j).

content.$t: It should use a browser action.

from product review:
Uninstalling an extension needs some "oops" protection.  You should either 
get a "Are you sure you want to..." confirmation dialog or a way to undo an 
uninstall.

Cole has provided us with a lovely new default extension icon which better 
represents lack-of-icon-ness.

This is only meant to be used in the install (and uninstall) dialog, and in 
the entries in the manage UI. It shouldn't be used for the header graphic on 
the manage UI.

title.$t: Crash in ExtensionMessageService::OpenChannelToTabOnUIThread

content.$t:
1. Load an extension that uses chrome.tabs.sendRequest from a popup. The 
messaging/timing example extension is a good one.
2. Open the popup and have sendRequest be called.
3. Close the popup.

If you do #3 while the message call is mid-flight, you get a crash due to the 
RenderProcessHost being NULL.

title.$t: Upper/lowercase in extensions management UI

content.$t:
From Kathy:

I just noticed that the Installed Extensions page, in Developer mode,
uses 'Extension' incorrectly in buttons. It should use 'extension',
since buttons use sentence case and "extension" isn't preceded by
"Google Chrome".

So we should have:

Load extension...
Pack extension...
Update extensions now

(It wouldn't have been so noticeable if it weren't for the lower case 
"now".)

Here's my understanding of what we use:

Google Chrome Extension ("Google Chrome Extension" is the only time
you capitalize Extension unless you're using title case)
extensions for Google Chrome
extension system

title.$t: We shouldn't have the extensions promo on the NTP of mac

content.$t: (as browser and page extensions don't work on mac yet)

title.$t: Install dialog warning text does not handle the case where content scripts can access the filesystem well

content.$t:
Currently the text says:

The extension will have access to your private data on .

The sentence is incomplete because file URLs have no host. The text should 
probably be:

The extension will have access to your private data on your computer.

Or something like that.

title.$t: Remove support for file:// URLs from content scripts

content.$t:
It isn't that useful of a feature and makes people nervous security wise. It 
also causes special cases since file URLs don't have hosts.

title.$t: [Extension] Some extensions crash after installing 4.0.249.0

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Go to http://www.chromeextensions.org/ 2. Install extension Twitter share this page, ChromeRIL, ChromeDial and Chrome Clock 3. uninstall your current chrome and then install 4.0.249.0 What is the expected output? What do you see instead? After new chrome browser launched(may need to switch between the default opened two tabs), 4 extensions crashed, they are Twitter share this page, ChromeRIL, ChromeDial and Chrome Clock. See attached screen-shot for reference.

title.$t: less padding on the extension "successfully installed" bubble

content.$t:
The bubble you see when you install an extension should have less padding 
around the sides in general and the close box should be a few pixels closer 
to the upper right hand corner.

title.$t: Regression: Forced rendering for every keystroke

content.$t: Chrome Version : 29857 URLs (if applicable) : Chrome appears to repaint on every keystroke, this causes significant performance degradation when typing inside pages with complicated DOM. This is apparent in the Google Wave client on machines with slow graphics rendering- (most apparent on Linux Chrome). This can also be reproduced inside a plain contentEditable div, after pasting in large content. Previously on machines with slow graphics rendering, typing will cause keys to be batched up and rendered a few letters at a time. With rev 29857, keys appear one at a time. This significantly reduces typing throughput when each render cycle is slow. Suppose the render cycle takes 200ms, then only 5 keystrokes can be processed per second. Steps to reproduce: 1. Open up Gmail compose, and make sure rich text editing is on. 2. Paste in some complicated DOM into the contentEditable, i.e. http://www.howtocreate.co.uk/tutorials/javascript/domtables 3. Type in the editor and observe that the letters appear one at a time. 4. If the machine renders the page quickly, the effect might not be obvious, in that case, copy and paste the page 3-4 times.

title.$t: UI feedback on extensions promo

content.$t:
Some feedback on the extensions promo from Linus:
* the yellow text promo should not touch the bottom of the NTP, it should be slightly higher
* the puzzle piece should never overlap with the NTP content. For small screens, we should have a 
scrollbar instead.

CC'ing the UI team so they can confirm.

title.$t: Need to flesh out docs samples page

content.$t:
We have lots more samples now, we should add them to the samples page. Longer 
term, it would be good to generate these, but for now we can just add them 
manually (unless it is crazy easy to generate them?)

title.$t: Visual issues with docs header

content.$t:
See:
http://src.chromium.org/viewvc/chrome/trunk/src/chrome/common/extensions/docs
/index.html

1. Search box should be right-aligned and vertically aligned with logo (this 
is different from other code.google.com docs pages, but we don't have the 
stuff they put on the right).

2. Too much vertical margin at top of page.

3. Too much left padding next to "Google Chrome Extensions (Labs)" header.

4. Not enough right padding to the right of "Terms".

title.$t: We should skip file:// entries in content scripts matches, not make them errors

content.$t:
We have extensions in the field that have this in their manifests, they 
shouldn't start erroring.

title.$t: Need to point code.google.com/chrome/extensions at trunk

content.$t:
We're going to be making several last minute changes to the docs and don't 
want to wait for a dev channel push.

title.$t: Do not run user scripts on chrome.google.com

content.$t:
Obviously, it is not a good idea to allow extensions to modify the display of 
their own ratings, security UI, etc.

title.$t: Info bar for setting Chrome as default browser doesn't come up

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Make IE as default browser 2. Install Beta(223.*) or Dev(249.*) build 3. On First Run UI, uncheck the option "make chrome as default" 4. Start Chrome and Exit 5. Relaunch chrome Issue: Info bar is not seen that Chrome is not default browser This works fine with Stable build 195.*

title.$t: Re-allow file:// access to content scripts

content.$t:
We recently disallowed access to file:// URLs for content scripts because of 
bugs in our install UI that we didn't want to have to fix for beta.

However, it turns out teams are relying on this so we should roll it back and 
fix the UI bugs.

content.$t:
This is our number #3 top crasher (9%) in the renderer for 249, or #1 if 
you don't count the out of memory ones.


Product: Chrome

title.$t: chrome-extension:// iframes cannot use chrome.* APIs

content.$t: Chrome Version (from the about:version page): 5.0.342.1 (Official Build 40461) dev Is this the most recent version: From the repository? Yes. It's not trunk, though. OS + version: Debian Lenny 5.0.4 CPU architecture (32-bit / 64-bit): 64-bit Window manager: GNOME/Metacity URLs (if relevant): N/A Behavior in Linux Firefox: N/A Behavior in Windows Chrome (if you have access to it): Don't know What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Create an HTML page and package it with your extension. 2. Inject the HTML page into a site using an <iframe>. 3. Try to use the chrome.* APIs from within the <iframe>. What is the expected result? Such a thing is possible. What happens instead? The chrome.* APIs do not exist. Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot and backtrace if possible. The problem here is, I tried loading "chrome-extension://foobar/page.html" using an <iframe>. The <iframe> cannot access the DOM of the site it's injected into due to the same-origin policy. But it also can't use the chrome.* APIs. In effect, the <iframe> is completely isolated from everything. Despite being packaged with the extension, it cannot communicate with the extension via chrome.extension.sendRequest. It also cannot access the DOM of the page it is injected into. This seems like a rather silly restriction to me seeing as how the site cannot access the <iframe> (once again, due to the same-origin policy). As such, I don't see any reason to not give the <iframe> access to the chrome.* APIs. Alternatively, don't give the chrome.* APIs, but allow the <iframe> to access it's parent's DOM. That would be acceptable as well.

title.$t: DCHECK triggered in ClientSocker::UseHistory.set_was_ever_connected

content.$t:
The HttpProxyClientSocket reuses the same TcpClientSocket if the underlying TCP connection was closed by doing a Disconnect followed by a Connect. This
triggered a DCHECK in set_was_ever_connected because was_used_to_convey_data_ was true.

Either a new UseHistory should be created at this point, or it should be Reset at disconnect time. Jim prefers the latter.

Navigate to www.yahoo.com 4. Bring up context menu and choose save as... What is the expected output? Download bar should be open. I think we shouldn't auto close in this scenario. What do you see instead? As soon as the windows save dialog is seen, download bar disappears Google Chrome 7.0.512.0 (Official Build 58142)

title.$t: MSVR-10-0105: Cross origin bypass using canvas and video

content.$t:
=================================
The following Software vulnerability report is highly confidential and should be limited in distribution to members of the engineering team within your organization with need-to-know for performance of security risk analysis and remediation.

We ask you to please direct all communications through msvr@microsoft.com for business and legal continuity purposes and not to the individual finder or other contacts you may have at Microsoft Corporation.
=================================

While working on Canvas we found a security bug in Chrome and Opera’s handling of the Video tag + CANVAS.  The Canvas Spec has a security section <http://dev.w3.org/html5/spec/the-canvas-element.html#security-with-canvas-elements>  which explains how to mitigate information leakage from cross-origin scripts. Chrome does not mitigate risk when the original Video URL is redirected; I have detailed 2 scenarios below to explain each case. 

Core Issue: The problem is that Chrome is only evaluating the original URL of the video when deciding whether or not to allow it to be rendered on a CANVAS and whether or not that canvas is considered origin-clean.

In a “false-clean” case, Chrome fails to notice that the original URL goes to a cross-origin URL and allows reading of the image from the canvas. This should not be allowed.

In a “false-dirty” case, Chrome fails to notice that the redirect goes back to the original page and thus prevents reading of the image from the canvas. This should be allowed.

I do not have PoC handy for this but can provide sample HTML5 if required.

Thanks

Steve Manzuik
Microsoft Vulnerability Research (MSVR)
msvr@microsoft.com

title.$t: Network code isn't robust to filesystem going away (?)

content.$t:
On Mondays, we get a bunch of email from people saying that "The site's 
security certificate is not valid!". This seems related to a whole cluster 
of weird behaviours reported on the chrome-linux, probably because people's 
kerberose tickets expire over the weekend.

Spewing multiple times a second:
[12157:28244:1203445930168:ERROR:/work/chromium/src/net/base/x509_certificat
e_nss.cc(469)] CERT_PKIXVerifyCert failed err=-8179

I am assuming this has something to do with the networking code not being 
robust in the face of the filesystem going away.

title.$t: /etc/apt/sources.list.d/google-chrome.list keeps reappearing

content.$t:
Chrome Version       : 3.0.191.3-r19935
OS + version : Ubuntu 9.04

I think it's neat that Google Chrome automatically adds the Google 
Repository whenever it is run. However, some people like to keep their apt 
sources organized. If anything, the apt source should only appear on first 
run, and never again.

I suggest making a separate package called "google-keyring" or similar, 
like some other repositories do, such as Medibuntu. The package installs 
the apt source into /etc/apt/sources.list.d/, and also the keyring for 
Google's packages, then the user is free to rearrange their apt sources.

Hopefully, if Canonical will implement repository addition in apturl, this 
problem will be a moot point. There have been many ideas about it at 
brainstorm.ubuntu.com, but Canonical has not said anything yet.

content.$t: Chrome Version : 4.0.202.2 (Official Build 23795) OS + version : Fedora 11 CPU architecture (32-bit / 64-bit): 32-bit window manager : Gnome 2.26.1 URLs (if applicable) : Behavior in Firefox 3.x (if applicable): Behavior in Chrome for Windows (optional): What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Open a tab in Chrome 2. Bring up task manager 3. Select any process and click on end process button What is the expected result? process will get killed What happens instead? nothing Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot and backtrace if possible.

title.$t: Linux: Not able to get the default save page as directory on non-English locales

content.$t:
Build: 4.0.203.2 (Official Build 24690)
   OS: Ubuntu 9.04 32-bit

Other Browsers:
    Firefox3.5: OK

Steps:
1. Launch Chrome Linux on Italian version of Ubuntu
2. Navigate to google.com
3. Hit Ctrl+S to save the page as
4. Observe

Result:
You will get some error message indicating that "Not able to get 
/home/testing/Desktop, no such directory", it is because this directory is 
translated on localized version of Ubuntu

Expected:
Should be able to save page as on non-English locale

Notes:
On the localized version of Ubuntu, the related system directories are 
translated, for example:
Italian: /home/testing/Destop will be /home/testing/Scrivania
Chinese: /home/testing/Destop will be /home/testing/桌面

Please refer to the screenshot attached.

title.$t: REGRESSION: Ctrl+F results in "а" added to the edit box in belarusian

content.$t: Chrome Version : 4.0.206.0 (Official Build 25285) OS + version : ubuntu hardy CPU architecture (32-bit / 64-bit): 64 window manager : URLs (if applicable) : Behavior in Firefox 3.x (if applicable): Behavior in Chrome for Windows (optional): What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. go into any edit box 2. switch input language to Belarusian 3. press Ctrl+F What is the expected result? search box appears What happens instead? search box appears, AND "а" (cyrillic letter occupying the same key as "F") is added to the edit box Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot and backtrace if possible.

title.$t: Crash when dragging loading tabs outside of main window

content.$t: Chrome Version : 4.0.212.0 (Developer Build Ubuntu build 26808) OS + version : Ubuntu 9.04 CPU architecture (32-bit / 64-bit): 32-bit window manager : Gnome URLs (if applicable) : http://gmail.com What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Start up maximized Chromium window and open up a new tab 2. Start loading http://gmail.com in the new tab 3. Keep dragging the tab in and out of the main chromium window and the process will crash What is the expected result? N/A What happens instead? Eventually the process will crash with a segmentation violation in cairo_xlib_surface_create. I frequently run into this problem when I'm moving a tab which has started to load and accidentally move it outside of the Chromium window. Reproducible in 95% of the tests on my system. Let me know if there are binaries with debug info which would produce a better backtrace.

title.$t: Attaching a large directory causes browser hang with 100% cpu

content.$t:
Noticed on the linux dev channel with 4.0.213.1 but might be older.

I accidentally attached a directory by typing its name (without
trailing slash).  If the directory is large, the browser locks
up after a few seconds with 100% cpu.  It seems to close if you
click the go-away box, but a process is still burning 100% cpu
from then on.

The UI should open the directory rather than try to attach it.

title.$t: various samples extensions crash chrome

content.$t: Chrome Version : 4.0.223.11 (Official Build 29900) OS + version : ubuntu 9.04 CPU architecture (32-bit / 64-bit): 32 What steps will reproduce the problem? The following "samples/" extensions from svn cause Linux Chrome to crash: - gmail_browser_action (hover crash) - make_page_red (hover crash) - print_browser_action (cancel crash) - test_browser_action (click crash) - test_page_action (click crash) What is the expected result? no crashes What happens instead? crashes take down whole browser Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot and backtrace if possible. Let me know if I should provide any more information. Also happy to split into separate bugs if that is useful.

title.$t: Need Linux implementation of AddressWatchTask() in syncapi.cc

Without this a network disconnection would cause sync to stop sending 
events.

title.$t: pipe file descriptor leak

content.$t: Chrome Version (from the about:version page): 5.0.307.5 dev (5.0.307.5-r37950) Is this the most recent version: yes OS + version: Ubuntu 8.04 CPU architecture (32-bit / 64-bit): 32-bit Window manager: kwin URLs (if relevant): n/a Behavior in Linux Firefox: n/a Behavior in Windows Chrome (if you have access to it): What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Run chrome for a couple hours (visit urls, create and close close tabs) What is the expected result? The browser continues to show web pages. What happens instead? When I ask chrome to visit a URL, it errors with net::ERR_FAILED. Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot and backtrace if possible. I noticed chrome print this to stdout/stderr: [10781:10829:2795849905217:ERROR:/usr/local/google/b/slave/chrome-official- linux/build/src/chrome/browser/sync/notifier/base/linux/async_network_alive_li nux.cc(21)] Could not create pipe for exit signal.: Too many open files /proc/$CHROME_BROWSER_PID/fd/ shows that the chrome browser process has just under 1024 file descriptors open. The standard Linux per-process limit is 1024. Almost all of these file descriptors reference pipes. For some of the low-numbered file descriptors that reference pipes, the pipe is also open under a second file descriptor in the same process (that is, for /proc/10781/fd/50 -> socket:[10494937], another pipe file descriptor in this process, 10781, for 10494937 is open). However, for most of the pipe file descriptors, there is only one file descriptor, not two, for the pipe across all processes. If I attach gdb to the process and close some of these high-numbered pipe file descriptors, chrome regains the ability to visit URLs. Thus, it appears that there is a pipe file descriptor leak in the browser process. I began to notice this behavior no more than two weeks ago. mdm@chromium.org helped investigate this behavior (thanks).

title.$t: Basic emacs key bindings should work (e.g., ctrl-e, ctrl-a, ctrl-d), like in native text fields

content.$t: Chrome Version : 2.0.181.1 (Developer Build ) URLs (if applicable) : OS version : 10.5.7 Behavior in Safari 3.x/4.x OK Behavior in Firefox 3.x (if applicable): OK What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Type in a text field 2. ctrl-e should take you to the end of the line 3. ctrl-a should take you to the beginning of the line 4. ctrl-d should delete the char in front of the cursor What is the expected result? - ctrl-e should take you to the end of the line - ctrl-a should take you to the beginning of the line - ctrl-d should delete the char in front of the cursor This is how normal native text fields behave on OS X. What happens instead? - ctrl-e: nothing - ctrl-a: select all - ctrl-d: nothing

title.$t: Back/forward via keyboard shortcuts (command-left/right and backspace/delete) not working

content.$t: Chrome Version : Version 3.0.182 (182.0) - build 16776 OS version : OS X 10.5.7 Behavior in Safari 4 PB : OK Behavior in Firefox 3.0.10 : OK What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Open any url that contains a link 2. Click on this link 3. Press backspace or option+left What is the expected result? Go one page back in history. What happens instead? Nothing.

title.$t: Unable to view sites for which both IPv6 and IPv4 addresses are published when only IPv4 is available, "Page not found - connection failure"

content.$t: Chrome Version : Version 3.0.183 (183.0) URLs (if applicable) : http://www.virus.org/ OS version : 10.5.6 Behavior in Safari 3.x/4.x: Works flawlessly Behavior in Firefox 3.x (if applicable): Works flawlessly Behaviour in Chrome on Windows: Works flawlessly What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Attempt to visit http://www.virus.org or any other IPv6 enabled site 2. Machine must have valid IPv6 address and be connected to the internet using IPv6 and IPv4 What is the expected result? Page to load normally What happens instead? The site above has an IPv6 and IPv4 address, when attempting to resolve the address Chromium fails with the following error Error 109 (net::ERR_ADDRESS_UNREACHABLE): Unknown error. Sometimes it will also fail with the clean error page for a missing file ('Oops! This link appears to be broken.' page) with the error of 'Page not found - connection failure' in the top right. However when attempting to visit the site with the IPv4 address and without IPv6 the site is accessible.

content.$t:
Tracking bug for the Mac OS known issue:
Printing a webpage is not implemented.

title.$t: if auto-update happens, About box should say "update is available" and "restart needed for latest version"

content.$t: Chrome Version 182.1 : <from About Google Chrome/Chromium> URLs (if applicable) : OS version : 10.5.7 What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Use browser and allow auto-update to happen whilst running 2. Check About Box 3. Not version is still old version What is the expected output? Should say "update is available" & "Restart needed for latest version" What do you see instead? Update not available.

title.$t: New Tab has gotten 25% slower since start of May

content.$t:
If you look at the perf graph for new tab time:

http://build.chromium.org/buildbot/perf/mac-release/new-tab-ui-cold/report.html?history=1500

You'll see a 25% slowdown from the start of May (approx CL 15800) to the
start of June (approx CL 17600).

This could just be due to us adding features, but if there's a smoking gun,
we should look and see if we can isolate it so we know.

title.$t: [Mac] SSL: no interstitial warning message for revoked certificate

content.$t: Build 3.0.182.5 (Mac) --------------------- URL = https://chrometws.corp.google.com:451 Test matrix: https://spreadsheets.google.com/a/google.com/ccc?key=rAS3hEXRii2KZ-QqAXz8zSw# Certificate: https://www.corp.google.com/~pjohnson/no_crawl/crt/atticus.crt How-to install certificate: http://dev.chromium.org/developers/testing Preconditions: -------------- 1. Have certificate installed on client machine before test. 2. Close, reopen Chrome before each certificate test. a. If Chrome is running: from Apple menu, Chrome > Quit Google Chrome. b. Launch Chrome What steps will reproduce the problem? -------------------------------------- 1. Navigate to page with revoked certificate: https://chrometws.corp.google.com:451 What is the expected output? ---------------------------- SSL interstitial page should read, "The server's security certificate is revoked!". What do you see instead? ------------------------ No SSL interstitial warning, navigates directly to target page.

title.$t: OSX UI glitch: Push button caps are flipped vertically

content.$t: Chrome Version : <3.0.184 (184.0)> URLs (if applicable) : OS version : <OSX 10.5.7> UI glitch: push buttons caps are flipped vertically. as I have my system themed, that's more visible (see attachment) the same buttons are drawn correctly by Safary and firefox and anywhere else in the system, so it must be something within Chromium k.

title.$t: Dragging a tab off while it's loading leaves the new window semi-transparent

content.$t: Chrome Version : 3.0.182.5 URLs (if applicable) : OS version : 10.5.6 Behavior in Safari 3.x/4.x (if applicable): creates a new window, fully opaque Behavior in Firefox 3.x (if applicable): does not create a new window Behavior in Chrome for Windows: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1.Open a tab for a website that takes a little bit to load (i.e. http://gallery.me.com/wood.shop#100015 ) 2. Drag the tab off the window to create a new window 3. viola! transparent window! If the page is fully loaded, you won't see this behavior. What is the expected result? It should create a new window, non semi-transparent. What happens instead? You end up with a window that is semi-transparent and is hard to make opaque.

title.$t: Dock menu crashes when selecting a closed window.

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Drop the attached file in /tmp or something. 2. Load it. It will popup a window, wait five seconds, and close it. 3. While loading, right-click the Chrome icon. 4. After close, select the Untitled window. 5. Crash! I would expect to have the dock menu updated, but that may be excessive. At least we shouldn't crash. Replicated in v3.0.189 on Mac.

title.$t: Support the mac find pasteboard (cmd-f should write to it, so should cmd-e. cmd-g should search for what's in there)

content.$t:
We should support cmd-e for finding the current selection.

(also should share the find pastboard if we don't already)

title.$t: Updating Mac Chrome causes the current running instance to lock up

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Run Mac Chrome until an update is available 2. Open a new tab 3. Try to navigate anywhere, and nothing happens I've had this happen several times now, where my running instance of Mac Chrome "stops working" when there is an update available. By "stops working", I mean you can't navigate anywhere, the new tab page content does not show up, etc. Native UI (like opening a new tab, "About Chrome") seems to work. It's hard to reproduce the problem, since you need to wait for a new update to be available. I noticed this problem today when Mac Chrome got into this state its version was 3.0.187.0. Once I quit the process and re-launched, the version number was 3.0.189.0 and it was functioning normally.

--> won't work; privs escalation needed

InstallerHelper can help here.

title.$t: some http requests take many seconds or minutes

content.$t:
I don't have really good steps for this, but I want to get down what I was 
seeing for the last two days on the hopes that folks who know the code 
will get some ideas.

This might be valid for all oses, but I saw it on Mac so marking it as such.

Verizon has had nationwide issues the last two days for some of it's Fios 
customers.  The issues have been 70+% packet loss but I think also some 
DNS issues also.  From an experience pov, the result is some web pages 
never load, some partially load, and some get lucky and work.

In Safari 4.0.1, I tended to see partial pages, with complete failures second 
most common.

In Chrome, I just about only see the tab stuck on the reverse throbber (dns?
) and it never really goes on from there.

If I close a tab that completely failed to load in Safari, then closing the tab 
and opening a new to the same url usually would get me the partial page 
or the full page.

But in Chrome, if I had something stuck, closing the tab and trying again 
resulted in the same thing every time.  If I gave up was willing to dump all 
my tabs, a quit and relaunch would almost always then let the page load.  
So it's like something about our dns state was staying stuck, hosting all 
urls to that host.

title.$t: Chrome keeps showing "Google Chrome did not shut down properly" message, when quitting via dock

content.$t: Chrome Version : 3.0.195.1 URLs (if applicable) : OS version : 10.5.7 Behavior in Safari 3.x/4.x (if applicable): N/A Behavior in Firefox 3.x (if applicable): N/A Behavior in Chrome for Windows: Quits cleanly without message What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. I open Chrome, navigate to a web-site, then select quit by right-clicking on Chrome's dock icon, and choosing Quit. What is the expected result? I don't expect a message saying "Chrome didn't shut down correctly". What happens instead? Chrome shows "Google Chrome didn't shut down correctly" message on next startup, and will continue to do so if I quit via dock. To get rid of the message, I have to close it, then select Quit from the menu-bar. If I quit using the menu bar, I don't get the message. Also, I'm not sure whether this error started when I removed Chrome using AppZapper, then re-installed.

title.$t: 10% slowdown in Mac startup tests

content.$t:
Mac startup tests are now 10% slower than the reference build
http://build.chromium.org/buildbot/perf/mac-release-10.5/startup/report.html?history=1500

About half the slowdown came about at r18927; the other half at about r19970.

See also http://crbug.com/13337 for a new tab slowdown issue.

title.$t: Text colors need to adapt to theme

content.$t: Chrome Version : 3.0.196.0 What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Install a dark theme, e.g. https://tools.google.com/chrome/intl/en/themes/theme_baseball.html What is the expected result? Text in the tabs, download shelf, etc, should be readable. See linux/windows. What happens instead? Text stays black and is hence not readable on a dark background.

title.$t: Themes ignore the background images for inactive tabs

content.$t:
The images for the inactive tabs are ignored.

An example is the theme "Cork Board" at the theme gallery:
https://tools.google.com/chrome/intl/en/themes/index.html .

title.$t: fast/repaint/overflow-scroll-delete.html crashes on mac debug

content.$t:
This layout test has been flipping a lot for as far back as the waterfall 
goes.  Adding it as flaky to test_expectations.txt.

title.$t: Inconsistent capitalisation in OS X application menus

content.$t:
Chrome Version       : 198.0 (Developer Build 22604)

Some menu labels use Title Case, others don't.

title.$t: Key Events in Flash also effect browser

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Go to http://www.addictinggames.com/stuntdirtbike2.html 2. Play a game 3. Cursor up to go faster! What is the expected output? Motorbike goes faster. What do you see instead? Motorbike goes faster AND content pane scrolls up. The key event should be consumed by Flash and not passed to the content pane.

title.$t: Mac Chrome defaulting to Windows fonts for user content

content.$t: Chrome Version : 3.0.197.12 URLs (if applicable) : <any> OS version : 10.5.7 Behavior in Safari 3.x/4.x (if applicable): OK Behavior in Firefox 3.x (if applicable): OK Behavior in Chrome for Windows: N/A What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Visit e.g. http://www.w3.org/Style/CSS/Test/fonts What is the expected result? For the standard OS X fonts to be used, like in Safari and Firefox. What happens instead? The monospace, fantasy and cursive fonts are incorrect. Attached are comparative screenshots between the three browsers.

title.$t: Keyboard input doesn't work in Flash

content.$t: Platform: Hostname: RohMac-2.local Mac OS X Version 10.5.7 (Build 9J3050) Processor: 2 Intel 2.40 GHz RAM: 2048 MB Chrome: Chrome version: 3.0.198.1 <<<Release>>> QuickTime Player: 7.6.2 Flash Player: 10.0.22.87 What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Open any url which has flash form which takes text input. 2. Try to input texts using keyboard in flash text box. Expected result: 2.1 Text can be inserted using Keyboard. Actual result: 2.2 Keyboard input doesn't work for the flash text box.

title.$t: Need Reliability data

content.$t:
In order to promote a dev channel release to the beta channel we need the reliability data.  Evan did this 
work for the Windows version.   I hope we can enable this for Mac and Linux at the same time.

title.$t: ProfileImpl::InitThemes is 9% of startup on Mac even with no themes installed.

content.$t:
I ran Shark on Chrome. ProfileImpl::InitThemes was 9% of startup, divided 
between GenerateTabImages (5%) and GenerateFrameImages (4%).

This was without any themes active.

It seems as though startup could be made faster by disabling this code path 
when the user hasn't selected a theme?

title.$t: Chrome uses 99% of CPU when opening 'attach a file" dialog in GMail

content.$t: Platform: Hostname: RohMac-2.local Mac OS X Version 10.5.8 (Build 9L30) Processor: 2 Intel 2.40 GHz RAM: 2048 MB Chrome: Chrome version: 3.0.198.1 <<<Release>>> QuickTime Player: 7.6.2 Flash Player: 10.0.22.87 What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Login to Gmail and click on 'Compose Mail'. 2. Click on 'Attach a File'. 3. Verify CPU usage. Expected result: 3.1 CPU usage is normal. Actual result: 3.2 Chrome uses 99% of CPU.

title.$t: fullscreen flash should cover the menubar

content.$t: It doesn't in 3.0.198.1 on Mac.

title.$t: RenderThemeChromiumMac needs updating to match the latest WebKit ToT RenderThemeMac

content.$t:
RenderThemeChromiumMac is in some desperate need of some TLC.

It seems to be a massively-hacked-up version of RenderThemeMac. It has
issues drawing on SL (see issue 12931) and it looks like it has various
hackeries in it to run at all (see line 995, in the middle of
setButtonCellState).

Both RenderThemeMac and RenderThemeSafari are using Cocoa to draw their
controls. We probably want the HITheme painting (or whatever successor API
there is). But as it is today, RenderThemeChromiumMac is unmaintainable.

title.$t: Heavy site (flash) doesn't load when opening in a group of 10-12 sites

content.$t: Platform: Hostname: RohMac-2.local Mac OS X Version 10.5.8 (Build 9L30) Processor: 2 Intel 2.40 GHz RAM: 2048 MB Chromium: Chromium version: 4.0.203.0 SVN Revision: 24101 <<<Release>>> QuickTime Player: 7.6.2 Flash Player: 10.0.22.87 What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Open 10-12 heavy weight sites with speed in different tabs. cnn.com apple.com lg.com engadget.com finance.yahoo.com hyundai.com ... ... 2. Wait for 15-20 seconds, when they are all loading, open other 2-3 heavy sites in different tabs (same window) - ford.com - gm.com - sony.com 3. Verify the sites opened in step 2. Expected result: 3.1 Chrome loads all the sites including opened in the step 2. Actual result: 3.2 Sites doesn't load (opened from step 2), even after refreshing the tab 5-10 times. Note: - I think when I say heavy weight sites, site is having the flash plugin. It appears that Chrome doesn't listen to step-2 sites at all and they are blocked somewhere.

title.$t: Tab to search bubble is wrong color

content.$t:
The tab to search bubble should be light blue with a slightly darker blue 
stroke. This used to be the case. In the latest build I installed it's now dark 
gray with no stroke, which is incorrect.

title.$t: First Incognito tab text appears as white

content.$t:
- open a new incognito window with one empty tab.

Expected:
- tab title is black

Actual:
- tab title is white. If you create a 2nd tab, the 2nd tab's title is black.

Not sure if this is theme related or just fall-out from Cole's ui CL landing.

title.$t: OS X: Firefox import will lock up if firefox is open.

content.$t:
Separating this out from another bug report:
"""
I just downloaded chromium-rel-mac/25188/chrome-mac.zip and installed it

Then I did: $ rm -r Library/Application\ Support/Chromium/

Then I fired up Chromium, and told it to import my Firefox bookmarks.

Chromium hanged after I selected the "import from Firefox" setting, and when I hit
"Cancel" it vanished but stayed in the Dock, requiring a force-quit.

I then tracked it with "dtruss" to see:

41975/0x13664d60:  stat64("/Users/alecm/Library/Application Support/Chromium\0",
0xBFFFE0B4, 0x0)                = 0 0
41975/0x13664d60:  stat64("/Users/alecm/Library/Application Support/Chromium/Consent
To Send Stats\0", 0xBFFFDF94, 0x0)          = -1 Err#2
41975/0x13664d60:  write(0x8, "\0", 0x1)                 = 1 0
41975/0x13664d60:  open("/Users/alecm/Library/Application
Support/Firefox/Profiles/hk5pytx0.default/.parentlock\0", 0x601, 0x1B6)             
  = 12 0
41975/0x13664d60:  fcntl(0xC, 0x7, 0xFFFFFFFFBFFFDE30)           = 0 0
41975/0x13664d60:  fcntl(0xC, 0x8, 0xFFFFFFFFBFFFDE48)           = -1 Err#35
41975/0x13664d60:  close(0xC)            = 0 0
41975/0x13664d60:  write_nocancel(0x2,
"[41975:523:798536773188735:ERROR:/b/slave/chromium-rel-
mac/build/src/chrome/browser/importer/importer.cc(494)]
Not implemented r
eached in void ImporterHost::ShowWarningDialog()\n\0", 0xB1)             = 177 0
41975/0x13664d60:  bsdthread_create(0x22ED5C0, 0x15DA40, 0x80000)                =
-1339920384 0
41975/0x13664d60:  __semwait_signal(0x3503, 0x3603, 0x0)                 = 0 0



...so in short, it is not fixed - but I have found the issue.

Chromium will not import bookmarks while Firefox is RUNNING; if you exit Firefox the
.parentlock thing above behaves differently and the import proceeds.

Could Chromium handle this gracefully, please?
"""

title.$t: Be more careful with USER_HOMEDIR in Mac sandbox

content.$t:
I found this while looking into what might be happening in bug 21476.

src/chrome/renderer/renderer.sb has:

; USER_HOMEDIR is substitued at runtime - http://crbug.com/11269 
(allow file-read-data (regex #"^USER_HOMEDIR/Library/Fonts"))  ; 10.6 
seed release

The substitution occurs in 
src/chrome/renderer/renderer_main_platform_delegate_mac.mm:

  sandbox_data = [sandbox_data
      stringByReplacingOccurrencesOfString:@"USER_HOMEDIR"
                                withString:NSHomeDirectory()];

This is bad.

We're replacing a string that's used in a regex without checking and 
escaping characters that have special meanings to a regex parser, like . 
(period), +, ?, brackets, and parentheses.  We're replacing a quoted string 
without checking that we're not doing something horrible that violates 
quoting.

title.$t: Tabs can be lost entirely by dragging tab upwards too quickly

content.$t:
- create a window with a bunch of tabs
- grab one and drag it up and let go of the mouse very quickly (timing is 
important, this isn't 100% repro)

expected result:
- new window with that tab

actual result:
- sometimes the new window will not appear and the tabs in the originating 
window will have a gap

Good times!

Layout issue seen - no styles applied as if css is not loading. On refreshing the page, issue is not seen Also seen on aol.com Please use labels and text to provide additional information.

title.$t: Startup tests leak chrome processes on Mac

content.$t:
I added 5 new startup tests related to extensions. For some reason, running 
the startup tests on Mac leak chrome processes. The startup tests wait for 
the processes to die, and eventually times out:
http://build.chromium.org/buildbot/waterfall/builders/Chromium%20Mac/builds/2
101/steps/startup_test/logs/stdio

This bug is about figuring out why the new startup tests result in leaked 
processes on Mac, but not Windows or Linux.

title.$t: Tab doesn't update until context menu displayed after waking from sleep

content.$t:
- put laptop to sleep (I've never seen this with my desktop) with no 
windows open
- wake laptop up
- click chromium icon in dock to show window with NTP (tab says "New 
Tab" as title)
- load a page like gmail.com

expected:
- tab title updates to Gmail page title

actual:
- tab still says "New Tab". As soon as I control-click to show a context 
menu, it updates immediately.

This is 100% repro for me on my laptop. The context menu solution makes 
me think it's a stuck message pump, but odd that I don't see this on my 
desktop.

pinkerton: Could you please reassign as needed.

title.$t: Can't play videos on CNN.com

content.$t:
- go to cnn.com
- click a video news story (eg, 
http://www.cnn.com/video/#/video/business/2009/09/20/levs.clunker.pa
yments.cnn)

expected:
- video plays

actual:
- empty area with "This CNN.com feature does not currently support the 
platform you are using."

This appears to be a recent regression, 211.2 works fine but ToT does not 
(r26674). Linux appears to be OK.

Can someone bisect this to see when this regressed (rsesek?)?

title.$t: Chrome crashes  for user with restricted profile Managed Parental Control.

content.$t: Platform: Hostname: testing-102.local Mac OS X Version 10.5.8 (Build 9L30) / 10.6.1 Processor: 2 Intel 2.40 GHz RAM: 2048 MB Chromium: Chromium version: 4.0.212.0 SVN Revision: 26685 QuickTime Player: 7.6.4 QuickTime PlayerX: <unknown> Flash Player: 10.0.32.18 What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Created a user with profile Managed Parental Control : System Preferences > Accounts, and created a new user of type " Managed with Parental Controls" 2. Enable access to Chrome browsers. a. System Preferences > Accounts , Select the above created user Click on the "Open Parental Controls..." . b.In the "System" tab select check the box " Only allow selected applications only" c. In the list of applications go to Others , select Chrome and "Chrome Helper" d. Check the check box " Use Simple Finder" 3. Fast switch to the above created user. 4. click on the application folder on the doc and. 5. Click on the chrome browser. 6. Dialog for "ksadmin" application not allowed comes up, click on "OK". 7. Launch chrome. 8. Quit and try to relaunch. What is the expected output? Should be able to relaunch Chrome. What do you see instead? Chrome Keeps crashing when ever user try's to relaunch. Note: Attached : text from apple crash report , Console Messages, ksadmin dialog screen shot. 1. Chrome only crashed if we select " Only allow selected applications only", when creating use. 2. Other products(Ex : Picasa / QSB ) using "Google software update agent"do show the ksadmin dialog , do not crash. 3. Breakpad crash report is not created. [0x0-0x2bc2bc].com.google.Chrome[3802] [0918/121238:WARNING:/b/slave/chrome-official- mac/build/src/chrome/app/breakpad_mac.mm(61)] Breakpad disabled 4. It would be good if Google Chrome is listed in "Internet " section of application tab which contains all other browsers.

title.$t: Casing looks weird in the Text Encoding menu (View:Text Encoding)

content.$t:
Menu items like "Western (macintosh)" look wrong.  Mac menus use title case, 
and even if they didn't, Macintosh is a proper name and should not be 
lowercased like this.

In fact, in cases where the items contain proper names like Macintosh and 
Windows, maybe we should uppercase them on all platforms.

title.$t: Mac: menu bar visibility needs to be refcounted

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? Open two windows. make one fullscreen with cmd-shift-F. cmd-` to switch to the other one. Make it fullscreen as well with cmd-shift-F. Toggle it back to non-fullscreen with cmd-shift-F What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Expected: menu bar stays hidden until no windows are full screen Actual: menu bar appears when any window toggles back to non-fullscreen, leaving a fullscreen window plus menu bar visible. This also affects plugins, which can create fullscreen windows of their own (see http://codereview.chromium.org/257008). We should be tracking outstanding requests for fullscreen and only showing the menu bar when that counter is zero (since the menu bar is per app, not per window).

title.$t: We need to look at all the different process type and see about sandboxes

content.$t:
We did the renderer sandbox early on, but haven't looked since.  I believe 
windows sandboxes the helper extensions use for reencoding images, etc.  
We should go through all the process types and make sure we have the right 
sandboxing in place, might not hurt to get all the sandboxing into a common 
flow so it can log/assert if it gets a new process type without us thinking 
about a sandbox while it first gets created.

title.$t: Change "Change font and language settings" in "Under the Hood"

content.$t:
Language settings in OS X are changed in the system preferences; we should 
change the dialog button to "Change font settings" on the Mac side so users 
don't get confused.  (At least for the Beta launch -- and maybe forever, if 
there are no plans to change this?)
