title.$t: Data race on reference counter

content.$t:
I've noticed the following report while running chromium unittests under 
ThreadSanitizer (http://dev.chromium.org/developers/how-tos/using-
valgrind/threadsanitizer)

INFO: T0 is program's main thread
INFO: T79 has been created by T0 at this point: {{{
    #0  clone /lib32/libc-2.7.so
    #1  pthread_create@@GLIBC_2.1 /lib32/libpthread-2.7.so
    #2  pthread_create@* /home/timurrrr/valgrind-patches/valgrind-
10880/tsan/ts_valgrind_intercepts.c:556
    #3  (anonymous namespace)::CreateThread(unsigned int, bool, 
PlatformThread::Delegate*, unsigned long*) base/platform_thread_posix.cc:93
    #4  PlatformThread::CreateNonJoinable(unsigned int, 
PlatformThread::Delegate*) base/platform_thread_posix.cc:113
    #5  base::LinuxDynamicThreadPool::PostTask(Task*) 
base/worker_pool_linux.cc:138

namespace)::WorkerPoolImpl::PostTask(tracked_objects::Location const&, 
Task*, bool) base/worker_pool_linux.cc:45
    #7  WorkerPool::PostTask(tracked_objects::Location const&, Task*, bool) 
base/worker_pool_linux.cc:90
    #8  (anonymous namespace)::InFlightIO::PostWrite(disk_cache::File*, 
void const*, unsigned int, unsigned int, disk_cache::FileIOCallback*, bool) 
net/disk_cache/file_posix.cc:206
    #9  disk_cache::File::AsyncWrite(void const*, unsigned int, unsigned 
int, bool, disk_cache::FileIOCallback*, bool*) 
net/disk_cache/file_posix.cc:344
    #10 disk_cache::File::Write(void const*, unsigned int, unsigned int, 
disk_cache::FileIOCallback*, bool*) net/disk_cache/file_posix.cc:329
    #11 disk_cache::EntryImpl::WriteData(int, int, net::IOBuffer*, int, 
CallbackRunner<Tuple1<int> >*, bool) net/disk_cache/entry_impl.cc:337
    #12 DiskCacheEntryTest::InternalAsyncIO() 
net/disk_cache/entry_unittest.cc:194
    #13 DiskCacheEntryTest_InternalAsyncIO_Test::TestBody() 
net/disk_cache/entry_unittest.cc:229
    #14 testing::Test::Run() testing/gtest/src/gtest.cc:2069
}}}
WARNING: Possible data race during read of size 4 at 0x95E7184: {{{
   T0 (locks held: {}):
    #0  base::subtle::RefCountedBase::Release() base/ref_counted.cc:43
    #1  base::RefCounted<disk_cache::File>::Release() base/ref_counted.h:89
    #2  disk_cache::BlockFiles::CloseFiles() 
net/disk_cache/block_files.cc:196
    #3  disk_cache::BlockFiles::~BlockFiles() 
net/disk_cache/block_files.cc:167

net/disk_cache/backend_impl.cc:332
    #5  DiskCacheTestWithCache::TearDown() 
net/disk_cache/disk_cache_test_base.cc:88
    #6  testing::Test::Run() testing/gtest/src/gtest.cc:2076
  Concurrent write(s) happened at (OR AFTER) these points:
   T79 (locks held: {}):
    #0  base::subtle::RefCountedBase::Release() base/ref_counted.cc:36
    #1  base::RefCounted<disk_cache::File>::Release() base/ref_counted.h:89
    #2  scoped_refptr<disk_cache::File>::~scoped_refptr() 
base/ref_counted.h:206
    #3  (anonymous namespace)::BackgroundIO::~BackgroundIO() 
net/disk_cache/file_posix.cc:38
    #4  base::RefCountedThreadSafe<(anonymous 
namespace)::BackgroundIO>::Release() base/ref_counted.h:117
    #5  RunnableMethodTraits<(anonymous 
namespace)::BackgroundIO>::ReleaseCallee((anonymous 
namespace)::BackgroundIO*) base/task.h:228
    #6  RunnableMethod<(anonymous namespace)::BackgroundIO, void 
((anonymous namespace)::BackgroundIO::*)(), Tuple0>::ReleaseCallee() 
base/task.h:287
    #7  RunnableMethod<(anonymous namespace)::BackgroundIO, void 
((anonymous namespace)::BackgroundIO::*)(), Tuple0>::~RunnableMethod() 
base/task.h:272
    #8  (anonymous namespace)::WorkerThread::ThreadMain() 
base/worker_pool_linux.cc:79
    #9  ThreadFunc(void*) base/platform_thread_posix.cc:26
  Location 0x95E7184 is 4 bytes inside a block starting at 0x95E7180 of 
size 32 allocated by T0 from heap:
    #0  malloc /home/timurrrr/valgrind-patches/valgrind-
10880/tsan/ts_valgrind_intercepts.c:318
    #1  operator new(unsigned int) /usr/lib32/libstdc++.so.6.0.9
    #2  disk_cache::BlockFiles::OpenBlockFile(int) 
net/disk_cache/block_files.cc:240
    #3  disk_cache::BlockFiles::Init(bool) 
net/disk_cache/block_files.cc:181
    #4  disk_cache::BackendImpl::Init() net/disk_cache/backend_impl.cc:302
    #5  disk_cache::BackendImpl::CreateBackend(std::basic_string<wchar_t, 
std::char_traits<wchar_t>, std::allocator<wchar_t> > const&, bool, int, 
net::CacheType, disk_cache::BackendFlags) 
net/disk_cache/backend_impl.cc:222
    #6  DiskCacheTestWithCache::InitDiskCache() 
net/disk_cache/disk_cache_test_base.cc:64
    #7  DiskCacheTestWithCache::InitCache() 
net/disk_cache/disk_cache_test_base.cc:31
    #8  DiskCacheEntryTest_InternalAsyncIO_Test::TestBody() 
net/disk_cache/entry_unittest.cc:228
    #9  testing::Test::Run() testing/gtest/src/gtest.cc:2069
}}}

The report shows that disk_cache::File inherits base::RefCounted, not 
base::RefCountedThreadSafe though it can be used (and Release()d) from 
several threads.

Please note that a similar issue led to one of the past top crashers in 
Chromium
http://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=18488

title.$t: 100% cpu spin in nested event loop
Chromium thinks it is the default when Safari is the default

content.$t: Chrome Version : 4.0.222.2 (28505) OS version : 10.6.1 What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Using Safari Set Default browser to Chromium.app 2. Open chromium and see the non-default browser message 3. Select make default browser 4. Restart safari and see that Safari is now set as the default browser 5. Restart Chromium and see that it thinks it is still the default What is the expected result? Chromium should know itself What happens instead? Chromium thinks it is safari

content.$t:
[I spent a little time prototyping, posting to provoke buy-in.]

We have many stack traces with essentially no information because they are Cocoa functions 
terminating in isendAction:to:from: to a potentially-free object.  Example:
  http://crash/reportdetail?reportid=6780bf8640af6720

Now that we intercept that function, we could register some keys with Breakpad to report:
 - actual class of sender (usually stack has NSControl).
 - action being sent.
 - sender's tag, if appropriate (-commandDispatch:).

I think in many cases the action and tag would provide immediate triangulation on what control 
was sending the message, which would in turn probably make it clear what the freed target had 
been.

If this doesn't flush everything out, we could also consider additional tidbits, like:
 - sender's title, if appropriate.
 - sender's window's title, if appropriate.
 - information derived from inspection of the target internals (even a freed object may leave useful 
info to extract).

title.$t: Open window with features shut off causes URL bar and bookmark bar to appear, bookmark bar to float in the center

content.$t: Chrome Version : 4.0.221.8 (Mac OS X 10.6.1) URLs (if applicable) : http://www.whatthefuck.com (as authenticated user) > chat > popout Other browsers tested: Add OK or FAIL after other browsers where you have tested this issue: Safari 4: OK Firefox 3.x: OK IE 7: IE 8: OK What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Create a page with a link containing a javascript window.open() command, setting all features to 0 [ example: onclick="window.open( 'http://www.google.com', 'testWindow', 'status=0,toolbar=0,location=0,menubar=0' );" ] 2. Click the link 3. A window will appear with a URL entry field and a bookmark bar. The View menu will have a greyed out option for Always Show Bookmark Bar. Resizing the window will cause the bookmark bar to float around the window, aligning in the vertical center. What is the expected result? With all the features off, most web developers are assuming that they have control of the entire contents of the window, so I'd expect nothing else in that window. If a URL field and a bookmark bar is going to end up there, the vertical dimension should extend by the height of the two views, and the bookmark bar should definitely not float around. :) What happens instead? A window appears with a URL bar and a bookmark bar, and the bookmark bar moves around with a resized window. Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible. Screenshots provided, with bookmarks clipped.

title.$t: Chrome fails to download any file

content.$t: Platform: Hostname: RohMac-2.local Mac OS X Version 10.5.8 (Build 9L30) Processor: 2 Intel 2.40 GHz RAM: 2048 MB Chrome: Chrome version: 4.0.223.0 29072 <<<Release>>> QuickTime Player: 7.6.4 QuickTime PlayerX: <unknown> Flash Player: 10.0.32 What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Download any file. Expected result: 1.1 Chrome downloads the file. Actual result: 1.2 Chrome doesn't download the file. It shows 'Starting...' status but doesn't start download. Note: - This problem is not reproducible all the time, but happens quite often. We will update bug with repro steps/CL once we find it. - Adding evan (for rev 28856), jamesr (for rev. 28839), if they can guesstimate about the problem.

title.$t: Backspace causes "back" action when using IME in text input

content.$t: Chrome Version : 4.0.223.1 (Developer Build 29238) URLs (if applicable) : OS version : 10.5.8 Behavior in Safari 3.x/4.x (if applicable): OK Behavior in Firefox 3.x (if applicable): OK Behavior in Chrome for Windows: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. In a text field, start typing using an IME such as Pinyin or Hiragana. After typing a few characters, hit delete/backspace to correct a mistake. What is the expected result? It should clear the last character, allowing you to continue. What happens instead? It clears the last character, but a split second later, Chromium goes back a page. Comments from issue 12557 which caused this regression: Comment 53 by ping.nsr.yeh, Today (62 minutes ago) This newly changed behavior of backspace is producing confusion for users who use an input method - practically everyone in Japan, China, Taiwan and Hong Kong, maybe Korea too. Whenever I want to correct a mistyped keystroke during input, the browser goes back to previous page. See the attached screenshot. (in issue 12557) I'm composing a character that needs 5 strokes. I typed 3 strokes, see there is a grey underline for the 3 stroke characters to indicate that I'm still in composition mode. Then a backspace would go to previous page. Logically I'm pressing backspace to correct a keystroke inside the input box, but practically Mac must be doing something different to make Chrome think I'm not in the input box. It renders Chrome practically unusable unless you are sure to always make no mistakes while composing Chinese characters. Comment 54 by paradoxmo, Today (moments ago) I can reproduce this issue. The thing I have seen is that it does actually does seem to delete the character in composition mode but then it goes back a page anyway-- that is, it seems to be sent to both the IME *and* the page. For example I typed "ba" in Pinyin and then pushed backspace. The "a" disappeared but then a split second later, the browser goes back to the previous page.

title.$t: Mac Chrome enters state where a tab (gmail) fails to render and clicking tabs closes them.  Application has to be force quit.

content.$t:
Mac Chrome enters state where a tab (gmail) fails to render and clicking tabs 
closes them.  Application has to be force quit.

Observed in:
4.0.222.5 (Official Build 28804)

After a couple hours of use, with about 10 tabs open, my Gmail tab stopped 
painting.  Clicking the tab title (not the close button) caused the tab to close.  
Then clicking on other tabs closed them.  Finally, I was left with a browser 
window that had no tabs.  The Chrome menu was not responsive.  I had to 
force quit to get out.

title.$t: Tcmalloc's heap checker reports memory leaks from libevent

content.$t: Running net_unittests on Linux with tcmalloc's heapchecker enabled and HEAPCHECK=draconian the following report is printed at the end of the program: The 20 largest leaks: Leak of 9227088 bytes in 64077 objects allocated from: @ 0xd11028 event_base_once @ 0xd10d54 event_base_loopexit @ 0xc672b4 base::MessagePumpLibevent::Run @ 0xc5e911 MessageLoop::RunInternal @ 0xc5e931 MessageLoop::RunHandler @ 0xc5e9d6 MessageLoop::Run @ 0xb3111f URLRequestTest_FileTest_Test::TestBody @ 0xcb6931 testing::Test::Run @ 0xcba0a2 testing::internal::TestInfoImpl::Run @ 0xcba1d8 testing::TestCase::Run @ 0xcbac37 testing::internal::UnitTestImpl::RunAllTests @ 0xcbad87 testing::UnitTest::Run @ 0x9baf5d TestSuite::Run @ 0x9b9d59 main @ 0x2ba7a92f21c4 __libc_start_main event_base_once() and event_loopexit() are the internals of libevent (see third_party/libevent/event.h) The same leaks have been seen under Valgrind but are currently suppressed. Running Chrome itself with HEAPCHECK=draconian doesn't show these reports (they're wiped out by libpango leaks), but they still may be dangerous. To reproduce the reports, you should set the 'linux_use_tcmalloc' variable to 1 in your include.gypi and patch third_party/tcmalloc/tcmalloc/src/heap-checker.cc with the attached patch (suggested by Maxim Lifantsev) What happens instead? Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible.

If the dock process is restarted the dock will appear again. What is the expected result? dock reappearing when exiting fullscreen mode What happens instead? dock does not reappear Please provide any additional information below. title.$t: Import Bookmark Feature

content.$t:
Until we have Bookmark Manager in all its glory we should have a menu item 
which allows users to implement bookmarks on demand.  Essentially they 
should be able to repeat that portion of the first run experience.

title.$t: "Chromium Helper" orphan renderer processes remaining even with no tabs open after using a pop-up menu

content.$t:
After running for a while (a few days, up to a week), I see many (10+) 
Chromium Helper (renderer) processes sitting around even if I close all of 
my tabs. They are taking up 0% cpu.

Mark sees this too, and says they are all renderers as opposed to plug-in 
processes. I couldn't verify.

The good news is that when you quit, all the processes are correctly 
cleaned up and go away. The bad news is once you do this, you can't get 
them back to debug them and have to wait another week for this to happen 
again.

I most recently saw this with a release waterfall build from 10/21, well 
after jrg's change to fix exit_(). Current builds are very crashy, so it's 
difficult to keep one running long enough to be able to reproduce this.

Assigning to darin so he can find someone to take a look. Maybe we can 
get QA to help run some tests and see if we can't catch a stray renderer 
hanging around due to surfing patterns. We could be leaking a 
TabContents which would leak the process, but that seems unlikely. I think 
all of our UI code is tearing down the infrastructure correctly in just about 
all cases.

title.$t: Security: Flash does not lose focus, which allows things like key logging

content.$t:
Flash keeps always focussed, so it's possible to take keyboard input even if you're on another 
tab/application then the page with Flash. This could be used as keylogger.

Found on Chrome for Mac.

More info: http://www.jonathanhogervorst.com/49/huge-flash-vulnerability-in-google-chrome-
for-mac/

Demo (focus the Flash-object by clicking on it, switch to another app and try moving the square by 
using the arrows on your keyboard): http://www.jonathanhogervorst.com/wp-
content/uploads/exploit.swf

content.$t: In some languages the pref content extends off the side of the view.

Actual result: 2.2 Tab hang dialog pops up and renderer crashes. (I see high memory usage in Firefox, Safari also) Note: - This crash doesn't create a crash dump file. title.$t: Chrome hangs when a page wants to open several http auth sheets

content.$t:
Chrome Version       : 4.0.229.1

Some internal site wants to open several http auth sheets, which greatly 
confuses chrome (== makes the browser process hang).

This is probably caused by a page requesting resources that also have WWW-
Authenticate set? The http sheets probably need to be kept in a queue, and 
only one should be active at a time. How do the other platforms handle this?

content.$t: We should take a drop of Keystone before Friday the 13th.

title.$t: Crashing badly in tiny_malloc_from_free_list, heap corruption suspected

content.$t:
There are a lot of distinct crashes in tiny_malloc_from_free_list.  Looks like 
heap corruption.

http://crash/search?
query=product:"Chrome_Mac"+version:"4.0.237.0"+tiny_malloc_from_free_
list

237.0 already has 300-350 between 11-08 and today.
229.1 has between 150 and 200 between 11-05 and today, and the volume 
has been pretty low over the past couple of days.
223.11 has fewer than 50 between 10-25 and now.  223.11 was the 
current dev build for a long time.  223.8 was the current dev build for only 
a couple of days, but it only has 4 crashes in here.

It looks like we introduced some serious memory errors between 223 and 
229.

title.$t: command-arrows in text field adds boxes

- find a text field and focus it (google.com works)
- press command-left arrow

expected:
- cursor moves to end

actual:

This makes dev builds pretty darn unusable for anything real.

title.$t: Toolbar buttons in incognito window are white, should be black

content.$t:
- open incognito window

expected:
- toolbar buttons are black

actual:
- buttons are white, makes them hard to see.

Ben says this isn't intentional, release blocker. Assigning to Avi for theme 
issue.

Krisr, can someone on your team help nail down a regression window? It's 
been a couple of weeks, I think. I initially thought this was intentional so I 
didn't report it, but I guess it's not.

content.$t: Implement the bookmark bar import promo as described in bug 4374 comment 12.

title.$t: Offer to copy the application out of the disk image if run from there

content.$t:
When you double-click Picasa.app from its disk image, it offers to copy itself 
to /Applications.  That's nice.  Chrome should do the same thing.

This touches auto-update (in that I'd like to recycle some of the 
.keystone_install bits) and Keystone ticket promotion (in that if the user 
authenticates to install into /Applications, we can do Keystone promotion at 
the same time.)

title.$t: Tabs stop responding if other tabs are loading large pages

content.$t: Chrome Version : MAC CHROME VERSION 4.0.249.30 URLs (if applicable) : Any website with large amounts of data loading Other browsers tested: Add OK or FAIL after other browsers where you have tested this issue: Safari 4: Firefox 3.x: OK IE 7: IE 8: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Bring up multiple tabs. Load a small data page like news.google.com 2. Load in the other tabs websites such as Sports Illustrated or Fox News 3. Go back to the news.google.com and attempt to scroll or click on the links or otherwise interact with the website. What is the expected result? You should be able to interact with different tabs while loading different pages at the same time. Firefox, Safari, and Opera have no issues. What happens instead? Chrome locks up, allows you to switch between tabs, but will not allow you to interact with the websites on those tabs, regardless if they are loading or not. A dialog box pops up, and allows you to kill the browser or wait for it to load. Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible. The only non-standard thing is my internet connection, while high speed, is not as fast as some. I am on a 128kb/s download.

title.$t: [Mac] Changes to multiple bookmarks lock up UI thread for seconds

content.$t:
If the user has a large number of bookmarks, changing any bookmark locks up the UI thread for a 
noticeable amount of time, and changing multiple bookmarks at once multiplies this delay.

This is really showing up badly in the bookmark manager I'm implementing — I have 2000 
bookmarks currently stored in chrome, and dragging one URL in causes a noticeably janky pause 
before it appears in the list (maybe 500ms), while dragging in a whole folder of them from Safari 
completely locks up the UI long enough to beachball.

Shark profiling shows that 98% of the time is being spent in BookmarkMenuBridge::Loaded. This 
method regenerates the entire bookmark menu, and it's called every time any change notification is 
received. There's a comment "TODO(jrg): this is brute force; perhaps we should be nicer."

title.$t: Cookie manager should dynamically update its elements when clear browsing data on cookies performed.

content.$t: Platform: Hostname: testings-macbook-pro-15.local Mac OS X Version 10.6.2 (Build 10C540) Processor: 2 Intel 2.33 GHz RAM: 2048 MB Chrome: Chrome version: 4.0.295.0 r35884 <<<Release>>> QuickTime Player: <unknown> QuickTime PlayerX: 90.3.1 Flash Player: 10.0.42.34 Precondition: Make sure we have few cookies stored in computer. What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Go Chrome-->Preferences-->Under the hood->"Show cookies and website permissions" 2. Chrome -->Clear Browsing data. 3. Make sure we select the "Delete cookies" option and Clear data for this period-->choose "Everything" 3. Verify the opened Cookie's list. Actual: Cookies stays in the cookie manager's list even after clearing the cookies. It doesn't update dynamically. Closing and reopening of the cookie manager updates it. Expected: Should update dynamically when [Clear browsing data -->Cookies-->Everything] performed. Note: Cant compare the same scenario in other platforms, Since Cookie manager UI and Clear browsing data UI cant be viewed at same time. This is Mac-Specific.

title.$t: Disable "Create Application shortcuts" option in Page menu.

content.$t: Platform: Hostname: testings-macbook-pro-15.local Mac OS X Version 10.6.2 (Build 10C540) Processor: 2 Intel 2.33 GHz RAM: 2048 MB Chrome: Chrome version: 4.0.295.0 r35884 <<<Release>>> QuickTime Player: <unknown> QuickTime PlayerX: 90.3.1 Flash Player: 10.0.42.34 What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Open any web page 2. Verify Page menu and Chrome->File menu Actual: - "Create Application shortcuts..." option is enabled in page menu. ( But it doesn't works ) The same option displays in singular with no "s" in shortcut("s") ( Create Application shortcut...) is disabled in Chrome-->File menu Screen shots attached for reference. Expected: - Enable/disable the option consistently all over on chrome as per the implementation status. - Option name should be consistent in both the menus.

title.$t: Bookmark manager: "+" button doesn't work if Bookmark Bar is selected

content.$t: It should.

title.$t: "Recently Added" loses its star on clicking folder

content.$t:
- open bookmark manager
- click "recently added" folder

expected:
- should still have a star icon

actual:
- returns to using a "folder" icon until you close and reopen the window

title.$t: + button does nothing until tree is focused

content.$t:
- open bookmark manager
- click one of the folders on the left side
- click the + button

expected:
- new bookmark should be created in the tree on the right

actual:
- nothing happens

The + button does nothing unless you first click in the tree on the right. 
There's no indication of what's going on here or why it doesn't work since 
there's also no focus ring.

title.$t: Command-W sometimes closes the entire window instead of a single tab

content.$t:
We have anecdotal reports of this behavior happening again, after we fixed 
bug 19947. My guess is that something else is triggering the AppKit code 
that switches the window layering from a background tab and causing the 
menu updating flag to get stuck due to the timer never firing.

I have a CL in progress that forces the timer to fire on the main thread, which 
should fix the "stuck" issue, and added a DCHECK to try to catch in debug 
builds when we get into this scenario.

We should take this for beta

title.$t: Add local storage support to Mac cookie view

content.$t:
This change:
http://codereview.chromium.org/523139

Adds local storage support for both GTK and Windows.
Mac now needs something similar, the basic idea is:

. Add "Local Storage" nodes per origin
. Depending on whether a cookie or a local storage node is selected, display 
a frame with the relevant information
. Update unit tests

title.$t: Chromium scrolls top top when you click a link after trying to find on page

content.$t: Chrome Version : 4.0.249.49 URLs (if applicable) : chrome://history/ OS version : 10.6.2 Behavior in Safari 3.x/4.x (if applicable): fine Behavior in Firefox 3.x (if applicable): fine What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Visit the history page, e.g. by typing Command-Y. 2. Type Command-F to open the search box, then something somewhat down the page in your history. 3. Click the link that matches. What is the expected result? You go to the page. What happens instead? On the click, the page scrolls back to the top and you end up clicking something completely different.

0x00001fc5	 [Google Chrome Helper	 + 0x00000fc5]	
0x00000006			


The offending line is:
void MessageLoop::RunTask(Task* task) {
  DCHECK(nestable_tasks_allowed_);
  // Execute the task and assume the worst: It is probably not reentrant.
  nestable_tasks_allowed_ = false;

  HistogramEvent(kTaskRunEvent);
  task->Run();                                         <-------------------
  delete task;

  nestable_tasks_allowed_ = true;
}


Any chance we're holding onto a stale task?

title.$t: Cookie manager selects wrong cookie sometimes

content.$t:
The cookie manager still selects the wrong cookie on click every now and 
then. 
Repro:

1. Have my set of cookies
2. Search for "ap" (screenie 1)
3. Reveal "developer.apple.com" (screenie 2)
4. Click "developer.apple.com"

Expected: Should be selected
Actual: Another cookie opens and is selected instead (screenie 3).

(Also, why is no data shown for localstorage?)

See http://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=33248#c8 for 
screenshots.

title.$t: Mac: Deletion of bookmark with bookmark bubble up can crash

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 0. On a Mac, start Chromium. 1. Set up bookmark sync. 2. Create a bookmark; call it "foo". 3. Click on "foo", and click on the star button. 4. Go to another computer (not necessarily a Mac). Start Chrome/Chromium. Set up bookmark sync. 5. When "foo" appears on computer #2, delete it (on computer #2). 6. Wait until it's synchronized to computer #1. (Wait a while; you might be able to see it removed from the bookmark bar, unless the bubble is covering that up.) 7. On computer #1, change the title of "foo" (in the still-open bubble -- I don't know if this step is really necessary), and then click on "close". 8. Insert smoke and flames. This is r38010 off the trunk. Win and Linux Chrome don't crash. I bet I can (or will be able to) write an extension (to delete bookmarks in the background) which causes the same crash.

title.$t: Mac: deletion of bookmark with bookmark button context menu up or while dragging button can crash

content.$t:
This is similar to issue 34513 -- create a bookmark ("Foo") and set up sync 
on two computers. Or, maybe easier, write an extension that'll delete the 
bookmark after a delay. But now, on computer #1 (a Mac):

1. Right click the "Foo" button.
2. Then, with that menu still up, delete "Foo" on computer #2.
3. When the bookmark disappears, click, say, "Edit...".

Or:

1. Click and drag the "Foo" button on computer #1. Hold it down.
2. With your other hand, delete "Foo" on computer #2.
3. After a while, (on computer #1, with hand #1) release it somewhere 
(maybe elsewhere on the bookmark bar; it probably doesn't matter so 
much).

Neither of these crash on Win Chrome.

I'll write an extension to make these repros easier soon....

NPAPI::PluginStream::TryWriteToPlugin(char const*, int, int)


The last variation matches bug 25883 which makes me think maybe there's 
a case where we are calling in to QuickTime before SetWindow has ever 
been called, and we need to watch for that case and delay somehow (or 
maybe trigger a 0x0 setwindow at that point?).

It might be worth adding a CHECK to verify that and see if it fires.

title.$t: Beach ball with lots of local storage entries

content.$t:
- create 1000 local storage entries in your profile (I have such a profile, but it's from a googler. ask me offline and I'll share).
- open prefs, click "show cookies and website permissions"
- wait.

Beachball! 

The problem is that for cookies, we don't have an observer registered for all the TreeNodesAdded notifications. However, by the time local storage loads, we 
do, and we get notified for every...single....one, updating our cocoa model even when it's not necessary.

We need to either add some batching to the observer api or switch to being a data source which will allow us to be even lazier about how we create nodes.

Here's the stack:

#0	0x06c26281 in CookiesTreeModelObserverBridge::TreeNodesAdded at cookies_window_controller.mm:37

Bookmarks menus will be the width of longest bookmark and I can scroll to see bookmarks if the menu is longer than the screen allows. What happens instead? The width of the bookmarks menus max out at around 1.5 inches and cut off folder names and bookmark names. Bookmarks beyond the length of the screen are inaccessible because there are no scroll bars or arrows. Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible. title.$t: Remove chrome/common/accelerated_surface_mac dependencies from webkit

content.$t:
Per thread in email, we need to move chrome/common/io_surface_support_mac.* and 
accelerated_surface_mac.* into src/app so they can be used from webkit.

This also entails moving a bunch of x11 support utils.

I'll get to this, but it might not be a couple of days. I've got a few other things backed up in my 
queue.

title.$t: Mac: bookmark menus allow unfettered keyboard input while displayed ...

content.$t:
... and don't close upon keyboard input.

This manifests itself in various existing bugs (with a bookmark menu displaying, pressing Cmd-
Shift-B, or Cmd-Shift-F, ... others?). Here's another example:

With a bookmark menu displaying, you can press Cmd-L to focus the Omnibox, type some stuff, 
select (using the arrow keys) stuff in the dropdown, press enter to navigate, etc.

There are two possible fixes (broadly speaking):
(1) Modify the event hook to also look for key events and do the right thing. This may be tricky 
to get entirely right, given the tricky things we do with key events. My hunch is that it may be 
tricky in other ways as well, and wouldn't solve other "modality" issues which (2) might.
(2) Make the bookmark menus run a nested event loop (or possibly multiply-nested loops, 
depending on the semantics desired). This is the standard solution for this sort of thing, and 
would also let us get rid of the app-level event hook. (It's what's done by standard menus, for 
example.) It may be nontrivial to write a nested event loop which handles everything we need to 
handle.

title.$t: memory corruption from media layout tests taking out webkit_tests at times

content.$t:
the fyi bots and main waterfall bots have been getting wedged for a while now.  not every time, but with some frequency.

Why running the media directory of webkit_tests, we get the following:

100317 07:22:32 test_shell_thread.py:94   DEBUG Previous test output extra lines after dump:
TestShell(74256,0xb034f000) malloc: *** error for object 0x1b241780: double free
*** set a breakpoint in malloc_error_break to debug
TestShell(74256,0xb034f000) malloc: *** error for object 0x1abd1000: pointer being freed was not allocated
*** set a breakpoint in malloc_error_break to debug
TestShell(74256,0xb034f000) malloc: *** error for object 0x3b94400: double free
*** set a breakpoint in malloc_error_break to debug
TestShell(74256,0xb034f000) malloc: *** error for object 0x1ac35000: pointer being freed was not allocated
*** set a breakpoint in malloc_error_break to debug
TestShell(74256,0xb034f000) malloc: *** error for object 0x1b2187c0: double free
*** set a breakpoint in malloc_error_break to debug


at that point the test thread in question never does anything more.  So either its wedged or the script can't handle the text.  But then things have to wait for the build bot timeout for no more output to 
finally final and kill the test.

There's probably two bugs here, the corruption in the media tests but also the bug within the scripts such that things get stuck.

title.$t: "The Site's security certificate is not trusted" happens after starting Chrome first time

content.$t: Chrome Version : 6.0.447.0.dev (Mac OS X) URLs (if applicable) : https://hotspot.t-mobile.net Other browsers tested: Add OK or FAIL after other browsers where you have tested this issue: Safari 4: OK Firefox 3.x: OK What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Start Chrome Browser 2. From time to time, the first access will fail due to a "The Site's security certificate is not trusted". This will happen as when using a HotSpot, first secure URL will be the HotSpot Login URL 3. It seems, that it will only occur first time when Chrome has been started first time after booting MacBook Pro. 4. At same time, FF will NOT report any problems 5. Some time later, after restarting Chrome again and again, it will suddenly work What is the expected result? Certificate is valid ==> not error What happens instead? Security certificate warning Please provide any additional information below. Attach a screenshot if possible. - attached

title.$t: Pagedown/pageup inserts characters in textbox

content.$t:
Chrome Version: 6.0.453.1 dev

title.$t: Keychain items need re-authorization in 5.0.375.125

content.$t:
There have been a number of reports that Chrome 5.0.375.125 suddenly required re-authorizing people's keychain entries.

Mark, did something about our signing process or the bundling change in that build?

title.$t: Bookmark manager: bookmarks paste fails for the copied bookmarks

content.$t: Platform: Hostname: rohitbm-macbookpro.local Mac OS X Version 10.5.8 (Build 9L30) Processor: 2 Intel 2.40 GHz RAM: 2048 MB Chrome: Chrome version: 6.0.487.0 r55187 <<<Release>>> QuickTime Player: 7.6.6 QuickTime PlayerX: <unknown> What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Have a bookmark folder and 10-12 bookmarks inside the folder. 2. Open bookmarks manager. 3. Select bookmark folder from the left pane. 4. Do select all for all bookmarks in the right side and perform Copy and Paste. Expected result: 4.1 All bookmarks are pasted on the Paste command. Actual result: 4.2 Previously copied bookmarks are being copied. (ie. If we have selected one bookmark and did Copy, only one bookmark will be pasted even after copying all bookmarks.) Note: - I am able to reproduce this problem most of the time, but sometimes it works correctly.

title.$t: second right-click on a bookmark (manager) doesn't open the contextual menu

content.$t: Chrome Version : 6.0.490.1 dev URLs (if applicable) : OS version : 10.6.4 Behavior in Safari 3.x/4.x (if applicable):ok Behavior in Firefox 3.x (if applicable):ok Behavior in Chrome for Windows: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1.open the bookmark manager 2.right-click on a bookmark 3.immediately right-lick on another What is the expected result? the contextual menu should open for that other bookmark What happens instead? the previous contextual menu disappears, the other bookmark is selected, but no contextual menu appears. Plus, it isn't clear why the contextual menus in the BMM should have their own design (e.g. they have the default aqua design in the history tab). (PS: I reported others oddities in the bookmark manager, which seem to have gone unnoticed, see issues 46396 and 46399)

title.$t: quake2-gwt-port crashes occasionally with compositor on on Mac OS X

content.$t: What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Build quake2-gwt-port from sources at http://code.google.com/p/quake2-gwt-port/ and start the local server. 2. Run top of tree Chromium on Mac OS X with --enable-webgl --enable-accelerated-compositing. 3. Play the game a couple of times; allow the bad guys to kill you each time, and then press escape once dead to start a new game. What is the expected output? What do you see instead? Expect that the game restarts correctly. Instead, the renderer occasionally crashes. Currently I am seeing the following logged to the terminal when it does: Chromium Helper(23332,0x80210000) malloc: *** mmap(size=16777216) failed (error code=12) *** error: can't allocate region *** set a breakpoint in malloc_error_break to debug A few weeks ago I obtained a stack trace from gdb against a debug build which indicated memory corruption as a possible cause, but the code has changed substantially since then so I don't think posting the stack is useful. The debug builds are very slow and tend to not reproduce the bug.

title.$t: Nationwide Building Society online banking login is broken because onblur is fired before onfocus or onchange

content.$t: Chrome Version : 4.0.212.0 (Ubuntu build 26664) OS + version : Ubuntu 8.0.4 CPU architecture (32-bit / 64-bit): i386 URLs (if applicable) : https://olb2.nationet.com/signon/index2.asp (or goto http://www.nationwide.co.uk/ and click "Sign on") Behavior in Firefox 3.x (if applicable): Fine with 3.5.2 (also all earlier ones AFAIK) What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Goto https://olb2.nationet.com/signon/index2.asp 2. Attempt to enter passnumber digits What is the expected result? Digits for each box are initially present, but become *'s once entered What happens instead? They're *'s to start with, making entering the pin somewhat difficult!

title.$t: ChromeFrame does not respect IE Privacy features

content.$t: Chrome Version : Google Chrome 4.0.211.7 (Official Build 26751) WebKit 532.0 V8 1.3.11 User Agent Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.2; en-US) AppleWebKit/532.0 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/4.0.211.7 Safari/532.0 URLs (if applicable) : Other browsers tested: Add OK or FAIL after other browsers where you have tested this issue: Safari 4: n/a Firefox 3.x: n/a IE 7: FAIL IE 8: FAIL What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Visit cf:http://code.google.com/apis/gears/samples/hello_world_database.html 2. Allow access to DB 3. Add entries. 4. Click Tools / Delete Browser History. Delete ALL. 5. Restart IE. 6. Revisit cf:http://code.google.com/apis/gears/samples/hello_world_database.html Expect: History deleted. Actual: History not deleted. 1. Start IE8 in InPrivate mode (use -private command line) 2. Visit cf:http://code.google.com/apis/gears/samples/hello_world_database.html Expect: Database starts empty. Actual: Database entries present. 3. Enter some database changes. 4. Close IE8. 5. Restart IE8 and visit cf:http://code.google.com/apis/gears/samples/hello_world_database.html Expect: Database entries created InPrivate are deleted. Actual: Privacy circumvented. ChromeFrame and/or Gears should respect the user's privacy preferences and actions. See http://blogs.msdn.com/ieinternals/archive/2009/06/30/IE8- Privacy-APIs-for-Addons.aspx for more information.
